lines: Never lose sight of the fact that the most important yardstick of your success will be how you treat other people - your family, friends, and coworkers, and even strangers you meet along the way.
author: Barbara Bush

lines: At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into a kaleidoscope of new possibilities.
author: Jean  Houston

lines: It takes generosity to discover the whole through others. If you realize you are only a violin, you can open yourself up to the world by playing your role in the concert.
author: Jacques  Cousteau

lines: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
author: Abigail Adams

lines: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
author: Saint Augustine

lines: There will come a time when you believe everything is finished. That will be the beginning.
author: Louis L'Amour

lines: Changing the world is good for those who want their names in books. But being happy, that is for those who write their names in the lives of others, and hold the hearts of others as the treasure most dear.
author: Orson Scott Card

lines: A man may fight fiercely to hold his own in business; but he does not need to fight to get ahead of someone in the elevator, or up the car steps, or at the post office window. And no matter how strong competition is, business and personal courtesy make it easier and pleasanter for everybody.
author: William H. Hamby

lines: If we do not lay ourselves at the service of mankind, whom should we serve?
author: John Adams

lines: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: For every day that there is sunshine, there will be days of rain, it's how we dance within them both that shows our love and pain.
author: Joey Tolbert

lines: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function. One should, for example, be able to see that things are hopeless and yet be determined to make them otherwise.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

lines: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
author: Nelson Mandela

lines: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Camus

lines: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.
author: Albert  Schweitzer

lines: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age.
author: Sophia Loren

lines: Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You.
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: Smile at each other, smile at your wife, smile at your husband, smile at your children, smile at each other - it doesn't matter who it is - and that will help you to grow up in greater love for each other.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: There are two big forces at work, external and internal. We have very little control over external forces such as tornadoes, earthquakes, floods, disasters, illness and pain. What really matters is the internal force. How do I respond to those disasters? Over that I have complete control.
author: Dr. Leo Buscaglia

lines: Each day offers us the gift of being a special occasion if we can simply learn that as well as giving, it is blessed to receive with grace and a grateful heart.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

lines: When you are kind to someone in trouble, you hope they'll remember and be kind to someone else. And it'll become like a wildfire.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

lines: You know you're in love when you don't want to fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: Love the moment. Flowers grow out of dark moments. Therefore, each moment is vital. It affects the whole. Life is a succession of such moments and to live each, is to succeed.
author: Sister Mary Corita Kent

lines: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: Class never runs scared. It is sure-footed and confident, and it can handle whatever comes along. Class has a sense of humor. It knows that a good laugh is the best lubricant for oiling the machinery of human relations. Class never makes excuses. It takes its lumps and learns from mistakes...Class is comfortable in its own skin. It never puts on airs. Class never tries to build itself up by tearing others down. If you have class, you've got it made.
author: Abigail Van Buren [Pauline Phillips]

lines: I've learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions and not on our circumstances.
author: Martha Washington

lines: Self-trust is the first secret of success, the belief that if you are here the authorities of the universe put you here, and for cause, or with some task strictly appointed you in your constitution, and so long as you work at that you are well and successful.
author: Swami Kriyananda [J. Donald Walters]

lines: Beauty is an experience, nothing else. It is not a fixed pattern or an arrangement of features. It is something felt, a glow or a communicated sense of fineness.
author: D.H. Lawrence

lines: Because life is a living, breathing work of art, you are a painting as you go. Be a masterpiece. Drink in life. Laugh too loud. Compliment others constantly.
author: Nicole Johnson

lines: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
author: Henry Ellis

lines: Excellence is to do a common thing in an uncommon way.
author: Booker T. Washington

lines: We have all known the long loneliness and we have learned that the only solution is love and that love comes with community.
author: Dorothy Day

lines: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: I believe that the rendering of useful service is the common duty of mankind and that only in the purifying fire of sacrifice is the dross of selfishness consumed and the greatness of the human soul set free.
author: John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

lines: Learn everything you can, anytime you can, from anyone you can - there will always come a time when you will be grateful you did.
author: Sarah Caldwell

lines: Get over the idea that only children should spend their time in study. Be a student so long as you still have something to learn, and this will mean all your life.
author: Henry L. Doherty

lines: Friends are helpful not only because they will listen to us, but because they will laugh at us; Through them we learn a little objectivity, a little modesty, a little courtesy; We learn the rules of life and become better players of the game.
author: Will Durant

lines: Everybody likes to go their own way to choose their own time and manner of devotion.
author: Jane Austen

lines: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: The creative is the place where no one else has ever been. You have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover is yourself.
author: Alan Alda

lines: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: George S. Patton

lines: There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

lines: One man may hit the mark, another blunder; but heed not these distinctions. Only from the alliance of the one, working with and through the other, are great things born.
author: Antoine de Sainte-Exupery

lines: There can only be one state of mind as you approach any profound test; total concentration, a spirit of togetherness, and strength.
author: Pat Riley

lines: Cooperation is the thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.
author: Virginia Burden Tower

lines: The soul gives unity to what it looks at with love.
author: Thomas Carlyle

lines: Believe in your dreams and they may come true; believe in yourself and they will come true.
author: Unknown

lines: Love is an expression and assertion of self-esteem, a response to one's own values in the person of another.
author: Ayn Rand

lines: There is no teaching to compare with example.
author: Sir Robert Baden-Powell

lines: Champions aren't made in gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them - a desire, a dream, a vision. They have to have the skill, and the will. But the will must be stronger than the skill.
author: Muhammad Ali

lines: There is a wonderful mythical law of nature that the three things we crave most in life—happiness, freedom, and peace of mind—are always attained by giving them to someone else.
author: Peyton C. March

lines: One isn't necessarily born with courage, but one is born with potential. Without courage, we cannot practice any other virtue with consistency. We can't be kind, true, merciful, generous, or honest.
author: Maya Angelou

lines: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

lines: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
author: Edward "Ted" Kennedy

lines: Set out each day believing in your dreams. Know without a doubt that you were made for amazing things.
author: Josh Hinds

lines: I remind myself every morning: Nothing I say this day will teach me anything. So if I'm going to learn, I must do it by listening.
author: Larry King

lines: The greatest compliment that was ever paid me was when one asked me what I thought, and attended to my answer.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Listening is such a simple act. It requires us to be present, and that takes practice, but we don't have to do anything else. We don't have to advise, or coach, or sound wise. We just have to be willing to sit there and listen.
author: Margaret J. Wheatley

lines: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

lines: Each day when I awake I know I have one more day to make a difference in someone's life.
author: James Mann

lines: Your vocation in life is where your greatest joy meets the world's greatest need.
author: Frederick Buechner

lines: We must not, in trying to think about how we can make a big difference, ignore the small daily differences we can make which, over time, add up to big differences that we often cannot foresee.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

lines: Let me not hurt, by any selfish deed, Or thoughtless word, the heart of foe or friend; Nor would I pass, unseeing, worthy need, Or sin by silence when I should defend... 'The world is better that I lived to-day.'
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

lines: Make it a habit to tell people thank you. To express your appreciation, sincerely and without the expectation of anything in return. Truly appreciate those around you, and you'll soon find many others around you. Truly appreciate life, and you'll find that you have more of it.
author: Ralph Marston

lines: One of the sanest, surest, and most generous joys of life comes from being happy over the good fortune of others.
author: Archibald Rutledge

lines: A word of encouragement during a failure is worth more than an hour of praise after success.
author: Unknown

lines: If you realized how powerful your thoughts are, you would never think a negative thought.
author: Peace Pilgrim

lines: Compassion is the ultimate and most meaningful embodiment of emotional maturity. It is through compassion that a person achieves the highest peak and deepest reach in his or her search for self-fulfillment.
author: Arthur Jersild

lines: Giving connects two people, the giver and the receiver, and this connection gives birth to a new sense of belonging.
author: Deepak K. Chopra

lines: Compassion is the desire that moves the individual self to widen the scope of its self-concern to embrace the whole of the universal self.
author: Arnold Toynbee

lines: Don't worry so much about your self- esteem. Worry more about your character. Integrity is its own reward.
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

lines: A person is not given integrity. It results from the relentless pursuit of honesty at all times.
author: Unknown

lines: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: Trust in what you love, continue to do it, and it will take you where you need to go.
author: Natalie Goldberg

lines: Dare to be true: nothing can need a lie: A fault, which needs it most, grows two thereby.
author: George Herbert

lines: Remember, there are no mistakes, only lessons. Love yourself, trust your choices, and everything is possible.
author: Cherie Carter-Scott

lines: Follow your heart, but be quiet for a while first. Ask questions, then feel the answer. Learn to trust your heart.
author: Unknown

lines: Peace is not something you wish for; It's something you make, Something you do, Something you are, And something you give away.
author: Robert Fulghum

lines: We shall find peace. We shall hear angels. We shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds.
author: W. Anton Chekov

lines: This is the way of peace: Overcome evil with good, falsehood with truth, and hatred with love.
author: Peace Pilgrim

lines: A smile is the beginning of peace.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: If I have been of service, if I have glimpsed more of the nature and essence of ultimate good, if I am inspired to reach wider horizons of thought and action, if I am at peace with myself, it has been a successful day.
author: Alex Noble

lines: Goals. There's not telling what you can do when you get inspired by them. There's no telling what you can do when you believe in them. There's no telling what will happen when you act upon them.
author: Jim Rohn

lines: No more duty can be urged upon those who are entering the great theater of life than simple loyalty to their best convictions.
author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin

lines: To do something, however small, to make others happier and better, is the highest ambition, the most elevating hope, which can inspire a human being.
author: John Lubbock

lines: We must have a theme, a goal, a purpose in our lives. If you don't know where you're aiming, you don't have a goal. My goal is to live my life in such a way that when I die, someone can say, she cared.
author: Mary Kay Ash

lines: A man without ambition is dead. A man with ambition but no love is dead. A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive.
author: Pearl Bailey

lines: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
author: Bill Bradley

lines: The most important key to achieving great success is to decide upon your goal and launch, get started, take action, move.
author: Brian Tracy

lines: Friendship doubles our joy and divides our grief.
author: Swedish Proverb

lines: You have been my friend. That in itself is a tremendous thing... By helping you, perhaps I was trying to lift up my life a trifle. Heaven knows anyone's life can stand a little of that.
author: E. B. White

lines: I believe that friends are quiet angels who sit on our shoulders and lift our wings when we forget how to fly.
author: Lorraine Mitchell

lines: Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
author: Anaïs Nin

lines: Gratitude bestows reverence, allowing us to encounter everyday epiphanies, those transcendent moments of awe that change forever how we experience life and the world.
author: John Milton

lines: Some people grumble because roses have thorns; I am thankful that the thorns have roses.
author: Jean-Baptiste Alphonse Karr

lines: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
author: Sir Winston Churchill

lines: Put your heart, mind, intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
author: Swami  Sivananda

lines: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right'. Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: Napoleon Hill

lines: Extend to each person, no matter how trivial the contact, all the care and kindness and understanding and love that you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
author: Og Mandino

lines: You have the need and the right to spend part of your life caring for your soul. It is not easy...To be a soulful person means to go against all the pervasive, prove-yourself values of our culture and instead treasure what is unique and internal and valuable in yourself and your own personal evolution.
author: Jean Shinoda Bolen

lines: We are all functioning at a small fraction of our capacity to live life fully in its total meaning of loving, caring, creating, and adventuring. Consequently, the actualizing of our potential can become the most exciting adventure of our lifetime.
author: Herbert A. Otto

lines: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; but remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
author: Epictetus

lines: Hope is the dream of a soul awake.
author: French Proverb

lines: When the world says, 'Give up,' hope whispers, 'Try it one more time.'
author: Unknown

lines: It doesn't matter who you are, where you come from. The ability to triumph begins with you. Always.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: I do believe that when we face challenges in life that are far beyond our own power, it's an opportunity to build on our faith, inner strength, and courage. I've learned that how we face challenges plays a big role in the outcome of them.
author: Sasha Azevedo

lines: Be willing to have it so. Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
author: William James

lines: If we study the lives of great men and women carefully and unemotionally we find that, invariably, greatness was developed, tested and revealed through the darker periods of their lives. One of the largest tributaries of the River of Greatness is always the Stream of Adversity.
author: Cavett Robert

lines: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph. What we obtain too cheap, we esteem too lightly; it is dearness only that gives everything its value. I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress and grow brave by reflection.
author: Thomas Paine

lines: Challenges are what make life interesting; overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
author: Joshua J. Marine

lines: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
author: Ben Okri

lines: Live life fully while you're here. Experience everything. Take care of yourself and your friends. Have fun, be crazy, be weird. Go out and screw up! You're going to anyway, so you might as well enjoy the process. Take the opportunity to learn from your mistakes: find the cause of your problem and eliminate it. Don't try to be perfect; just be an excellent example of being human.
author: Anthony Robbins

lines: Start where you are. Distant fields always look greener, but opportunity lies right where you are. Take advantage of every opportunity of service.
author: Robert J. Collier

lines: A great attitude does much more than turn on the lights in our worlds; it seems to magically connect us to all sorts of serendipitous opportunities that were somehow absent before the change.
author: Earl Nightingale

lines: There will always be a frontier where there is an open mind and a willing hand.
author: Charles F. Kettering

lines: Parents, teach your children to express themselves. Teach them to be in touch with their emotions, to speak honestly to people, and to maintain integrity and stick by their principles in all they do. This is perhaps the highest morality you can instill.
author: Jeffery Bryant

lines: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great. Weak men wait for opportunities; strong men make them.
author: Orison Swett Marden

lines: Our character...is an omen of our destiny, and the more integrity we have and keep, the simpler and nobler that destiny is likely to be.
author: George Santayana

lines: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
author: Washington Irving

lines: You can turn painful situations around through laughter. If you can find humor in anything, even poverty, you can survive it.
author: Bill Cosby

lines: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.
author: Les Brown

lines: Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody else expects of you, never excuse yourself.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

lines: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Laozi

lines: Laugh at yourself, but don't ever aim your doubt at yourself. Be bold. When you embark for strange places, don't leave any of yourself safely on shore. Have the nerve to go into unexplored territory.
author: Alan Alda

lines: Confidence...thrives on honesty, on honor, on the sacredness of obligations, on faithful protection and on unselfish performance. Without them it cannot live.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

lines: The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.
author: Ralph Marston

lines: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.
author: Babe Ruth

lines: When your values are clear to you, making decisions becomes easier.
author: Roy Disney

lines: Respect your fellow human being, treat them fairly, disagree with them honestly, enjoy their friendship, explore your thoughts about one another candidly, work together for a common goal and help one another achieve it.
author: Bill Bradley

lines: Respect is love in plain clothes.
author: Frank Byrnes

lines: Dream your dream. Follow your heart. Imagine. Listen to the wind. Drink sunsets. Be free. Let the wonder never cease. Believe. Wish on EVERY star. Create adventure. Be Kind.
author: Debbie Coulter

lines: Sense shines with a double luster when it is set in humility. An able and yet humble man is a jewel worth a kingdom.
author: William Penn

lines: I have three precious things which I hold fast and prize. The first is gentleness; the second frugality; the third is humility, which keeps me from putting myself before others. Be gentle and you can be bold; be frugal and you can be liberal; avoid putting yourself before others and you can become a leader among men.
author: Laozi

lines: Humility leads to strength and not to weakness. It is the highest form of self-respect to admit mistakes and to make amends for them.
author: John J. McCloy

lines: You are here for a purpose. There is no duplicate of you in the whole wide world. There never has been, there never will be. You were brought here now to fill a certain need. Take time to think that over.
author: Lou Austin

lines: The road of life twists and turns and no two directions are ever the same. Yet our lessons come from the journey, not the destination.
author: Don Williams Jr.

lines: Reach high, for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep, for every dream precedes the goal.
author: Pamela Vaull Starr

lines: It was character that got us out of bed, commitment that moved us into action, and discipline that enabled us to follow through.
author: Zig Ziglar

lines: When you get in a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hold on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

lines: When work, commitment, and pleasure all become one and you reach that deep well where passion lives, nothing is impossible.
author: Nancy Coey

lines: Love yourself, accept yourself, forgive yourself, and be good to yourself, because without you the rest of us are without a source of many wonderful things.
author: Dr. Leo Buscaglia

lines: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
author: G. K.  Chesterton

lines: Dedicate some of your life to others. Your dedication will not be a sacrifice. It will be an exhilarating experience because it is an intense effort applied toward a meaningful end.
author: Dr. Thomas Dooley

lines: No steam or gas drives anything until it is confined. No life ever grows great until it is focused, dedicated, disciplined.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

lines: Life means to have something definite to do—a mission to fulfilled—and in the measure in which we avoid setting our life to something, we make it empty. Human life, by its very nature, has to be dedicated to something.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

lines: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms: it means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
author: G. K.  Chesterton

lines: Character is the total of thousands of small daily strivings to live up to the best that is in us.
author: A. G. Trudeau

lines: All doors open to courtesy.
author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

lines: There is something more - the spirit, or the soul. I think that that quality encourages our courtesy and care and our minds. And mercy, and identity.
author: Maya Angelou

lines: By sharing something, I realized that I'm not alone, that there are a lot of people that share with me the same preoccupations, the same ideas, the same ideals, and the same quest for a meaning for this life.
author: Paulo Coelho

lines: As man draws nearer to the stars, why should he not also draw nearer to his neighbor?
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

lines: Diversity is the one true thing we all have in common. Celebrate it every day.
author: Unknown

lines: The wise man belongs to all countries, for the home of a great soul is the whole world.
author: Democritus

lines: Only he can understand what a farm is, what a country is, who shall have sacrificed part of himself to his farm or country, fought to save it, struggled to make it beautiful. Only then will the love of farm or country fill his heart.
author: Antoine de Sainte-Exupery

lines: Only a life lived for others is worth living.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: I am a part of all that I have met.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

lines: We learn more by looking for the answer to a question and not finding it than we do from learning the answer itself.
author: Lloyd Alexander

lines: Whatever I have tried to do in life, I have tried with all my heart to do it well; whatever I have devoted myself to, I have devoted myself completely; in great aims and in small I have always thoroughly been in earnest.
author: Charles Dickens

lines: I cannot lead you into battle. I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else - I can give my heart and my devotion to these old islands and to all the peoples of our brotherhood of nations.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

lines: Above all be of single aim; have a legitimate and useful purpose, and devote yourself unreservedly to it.
author: James Allen

lines: Therefore hold to the things which are reliable. Look to simplicity; embrace purity; Lessen the self; diminish desire.
author: Laozi

lines: The average person puts only 25% of his energy into his work. The world takes off its hat to those who put in more than 50% of their capacity, and stands on its head for those few and far between souls who devote 100%.
author: Andrew Carnegie

lines: When spider webs unite they can tie up a lion.
author: African Proverb

lines: Take control of your destiny. Believe in yourself. Ignore those who try to discourage you. Avoid negative sources, people, places, things and habits. Don't give up and don't give in.
author: Wanda Hope Carter

lines: When there is no enemy within, the enemies outside cannot hurt you.
author: African Proverb

lines: A mind is a fire to be kindled, not a vessel to be filled.
author: Plutarch

lines: To be good is noble, but to teach others how to be good is nobler--and less trouble.
author: Mark Twain

lines: Example has more followers than reason.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

lines: What ever beauty may be, it has for its basis order, and for its essence unity.
author: Father Andre

lines: When you have a sense of your own identity and a vision of where you want to go in your life, you then have the basis for reaching out to the world and going after your dreams for a better life.
author: Stedman Graham

lines: Within sorrow is grace. When we come close to those things that break us down, we touch those things that also break us open. And in that breaking open, we uncover our true nature.
author: Wayne Muller

lines: Gracefulness has been defined to be the outward expression of the inward harmony of the soul.
author: William Hazlitt

lines: If one dream should fall and break into a thousand pieces, never be afraid to pick one of those pieces up and begin again.
author: Flavia Weedn

lines: Dreams come in a size too big so that we may grow into them.
author: Josie Bisset

lines: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
author: Frank Tyger

lines: The most basic of all human needs is the need to understand and be understood. The best way to understand people is to listen to them.
author: Ralph Nichols

lines: Appreciation...acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.
author: Alan Cohen

lines: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
author: Ashley Smith

lines: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
author: Pope John XXIII

lines: Compassion is sometimes the fatal capacity for feeling what it is like to live inside somebody else's skin. It is the knowledge that there can never really be any peace and joy for me until there is peace and joy finally for you too.
author: Frederick Buechner

lines: The value of compassion cannot be over-emphasized. Anyone can criticize. It takes a true believer to be compassionate. No greater burden can be borne by an individual than to know no one cares or understands.
author: Arthur H. Stainback

lines: No one's head aches when he is comforting another.
author: Indian Proverb

lines: I can live for two months on a good compliment.
author: Mark Twain

lines: Life has meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
author: Antoine de Sainte-Exupery

lines: No one is more cherished in this world than someone who lightens the burden of another.
author: Unknown

lines: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lines: To sit patiently with a yearning that has not yet been fulfilled, and to trust that, that fulfillment will come, is quite possibly one of the most powerful "magic skills" that human beings are capable of. It has been noted by almost every ancient wisdom tradition.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

lines: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
author: Ralph W.  Sockman

lines: The best things in life are never rationed. Friendship, loyalty, love, do not require coupons.
author: George T. Hewitt

lines: It is better to be faithful than famous.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

lines: We are all in the same boat in a stormy sea, and we owe each other a terrible loyalty.
author: G. K.  Chesterton

lines: Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead.
author: Louisa May Alcott

lines: 'Stay' is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary.
author: Louisa May Alcott

lines: There is nothing we like to see so much as the gleam of pleasure in a person's eye when he feels that we have sympathized with him, understood him. At these moments something fine and spiritual passes between two friends. These are the moments worth living.
author: Don Marquis

lines: All the so-called "secrets of success" will not work unless you do.
author: Unknown

lines: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: Work is either fun or drudgery. It depends on your attitude. I like fun.
author: Colleen C.  Barrett

lines: Strive to be first: first to nod, first to smile, first to compliment, and first to forgive.
author: Anonymous

lines: Open your heart - open it wide; someone is standing outside.
author: Mary Engelbreit

lines: We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips it's turn.
author: Hal Borland

lines: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
author: Christopher Reeve

lines: Were it not for hope the heart would break.
author: Scottish Proverb

lines: We either make ourselves miserable or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
author: Carlos Casteneda

lines: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
author: Thomas Paine

lines: Nothing is so strong as gentleness. Nothing is so gentle as real strength.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

lines: Still round the corner there may wait, A new road or a secret gate.
author: J.R.R.   Tolkien

lines: That which we persist in doing becomes easier, not that the task itself has become easier, but that our ability to perform it has improved.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lines: Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
author: Plato

lines: Live with intention. Walk to the edge. Listen hard. Practice wellness. Play with abandon. Laugh. Choose with no regret. Appreciate your friends. Continue to learn. Do what you love. Live as if this is all there is.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

lines: No amount of ability is of the slightest avail without honor.
author: Andrew Carnegie

lines: Better keep yourself clean and bright. You are the window through which you must see the world.
author: George Bernard Shaw

lines: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
author: Charles Swindoll

lines: In great matters men show themselves as they wish to be seen; in small matters, as they are.
author: Gamaliel Bradford

lines: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
author: David Star Jordan

lines: Just go out there and do what you've got to do.
author: Martina Navrátilová

lines: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lines: If you think you are too small to be effective, you have never been in the dark with a mosquito.
author: Unknown

lines: It is common sense to take a method and try it. If it fails, admit it frankly and try another. But above all, try something.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

lines: The heart may be broken, and the soul remain unshaken.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

lines: There are souls in this world which have the gift of finding joy everywhere and of leaving it behind them when they go.
author: Fredrick Faber

lines: Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard.
author: Anne Sexton

lines: Man is so made that when anything fires his soul, impossibilities vanish.
author: Jean de La  Fontaine

lines: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

lines: Perhaps the most important thing we can undertake toward the reduction of fear is to make it easier for people to accept themselves, to like themselves.
author: Bonaro W. Overstreet

lines: Few things can help an individual more than to place responsibility on him, and to let him know that you trust him.
author: Booker T. Washington

lines: The greatest power is often simple patience.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

lines: Look at what you've got and make the best of it. It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Proverb

lines: The last of the human freedoms is to choose one's attitudes.
author: Viktor Frankl

lines: I will offer a choice, not an echo.
author: Barry M. Goldwater

lines: Who, being loved, is poor?
author: Oscar Wilde

lines: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
author: Zora Neale Hurst

lines: For happiness is anyone and anything at all that's loved by you.
author: Charlie Brown

lines: It is in the shelter of each other that the people live.
author: Irish Proverb

lines: We're here for a reason. I believe a bit of the reason is to throw little torches out to lead people through the dark.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

lines: It takes two wings to fly.
author: Eric Schaub

lines: Men exist for the sake of one another. Teach them then or bear with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

lines: What do we live for; if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: Mary Ann Evans

lines: Water continually dropping will wear hard rocks hollow.
author: Plutarch

lines: How long should you try? Until.
author: Jim Rohn

lines: The difference between try and triumph is a little umph.
author: Anonymous

lines: Enthusiasm is the mother of effort, and without it nothing great was ever achieved.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lines: There are no traffic jams along the extra mile.
author: Roger Staubach

lines: Whoever said anybody has a right to give up?
author: Marian Wright Edelman

lines: Consider the postage stamp: its usefulness consists in the ability to stick to one thing till it gets there.
author: Josh Billings

lines: He who is devoid of the power to forgive, is devoid of the power to love.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Those who wish to sing, always find a song.
author: Swedish Proverb

lines: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.
author: James Neil Hollingworth

lines: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
author: Richard David Bach

lines: The mode by which the inevitable comes to pass is effort.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

lines: The small courtesies sweeten life; the greater, ennoble it.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

lines: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage with others.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: They can because they think they can.
author: Virgil

lines: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
author: Victor Hugo

lines: Some come and leave, fulfilling a single purpose; others, for a time or a season to teach us by sharing their experiences; and last, a select few who participate forever with relationships that endure through eternity.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: You are never given a wish without also being given the power to make it come true. You may have to work for it, however.
author: Richard David Bach

lines: Unless commitment is made, there are only promises and hopes... but no plans.
author: Peter F. Drucker

lines: Every calling is great when greatly pursued.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

lines: Example has more followers than reason. We unconsciously imitate what pleases us, and insensibly approximate to the characters we most admire. In this way, a generous habit of thought and of action carries with it an incalculable influence.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

lines: Your attitude is your altitude. It determines how high you fly.
author: Anonymous

lines: Sometimes when learning comes before experience it doesn't make sense right away.
author: Richard David Bach

lines: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter F. Drucker

lines: Man's mind stretched to a new idea never goes back to its original dimensions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

lines: To be honest, to be kind - to earn a little and to spend a little less, to make upon the whole a family happier for his presence, to renounce when that shall be necessary and not be embittered, to keep a few friends, but these without capitulation — above all, on the same grim condition, to keep friends with himself — here is a task for all that a man has of fortitude and delicacy.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
author: Segoyewatha [Red Jacket]

lines: You cannot escape the results of your thoughts. Whatever your present environment may be, you will fall, remain or rise with your thoughts, your vision, your ideal. You will become as small as your controlling desire; as great as your dominant aspiration.
author: James Allen

lines: Spring ushers in the birth and growth of new beginnings. Summer develops and matures new life in the warmth of light. Fall celebrates life and displays inspiration through color. Winter then rests and builds for the new day, preparing for the next season.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.
author: Richard David Bach

lines: Wherever we are, it is our friends that make our world.
author: Henry Drummond

lines: I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving... we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it... but we must sail and not drift nor lie at anchor.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

lines: God's promises are like the stars; the darker the night the brighter they shine.
author: David Nicholas

lines: Respect for intellectual excellence, the restoration of vigor and discipline to our ideas of study, curricula which aim at strengthening intellectual fiber and stretching the power of young minds, personal commitment and responsibility—these are the preconditions of educational recovery in America today; and, I believe, they have always been the preconditions of happiness and sanity for the human race.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

lines: Bloom where you are planted.
author: Unknown

lines: You've got to have a dream, if you want to have a dream come true.
author: Dennis Waitley

lines: Motivation is knowing you are learning, growing, and succeeding toward your desired outcome while sustaining positive momentum.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: When your views on the world and your intellect are being challenged and you begin to feel uncomfortable because of a contradiction you've detected that is threatening your current model of the world...pay attention. You are about to learn something.
author: William H. Drury, Jr.

lines: We must continually remind students in the classroom that expression of different opinions and dissenting ideas affirms the intellectual process. We should forcefully explain that our role is not to teach them to think as we do but rather to teach them, by example, the importance of taking a stance that is rooted in rigorous engagement with the full range of ideas about a topic.
author: Bell Hooks [Gloria Jean Watkins]

lines: Honest towards ourselves and towards anyone else who is our friend; brave towards the enemy; magnanimous towards the defeated; polite always: this is how the four cardinal virtues want us to act.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
author: Henry Lewis Stimson

lines: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Saint Augustine

lines:
To speak gratitude is courteous and pleasant,
to enact gratitude is generous and noble,
but to live gratitude is to touch Heaven.
author: Johannes A. Gaertner

lines: Loyalty is a feature in a boy's character that inspires boundless hope.
author: Sir Robert Baden-Powell

lines: Joy is but the sign that creative emotion is fulfilling its purpose.
author: Charles Du Bos

lines: A ship in port is safe, but that's not what ships are built for.
author: Grace Hopper

lines: The most unambiguous sign that a person holds men in low esteem is this: That he either acknowledges them merely as means to his ends or does not acknowledge them at all.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Perseverance is more prevailing than violence; and many things which cannot be overcome when they are together, yield themselves up when taken little by little.
author: Plutarch

lines: He is rich who is content with the least; for contentment is the wealth of nature.
author: Socrates

lines: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
author: Walter  Bagehot

lines: Human diversity makes tolerance more than a virtue; it makes it a requirement for survival.
author: Rene Dubois

lines: The harder you fall, the higher you bounce.
author: Doug Horton

lines: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: You need to be aware of what others are doing, applaud their efforts, acknowledge their successes, and encourage them in their pursuits. When we all help one another, everybody wins.
author: Jim Stovall

lines: It takes both rain and sunshine to make a rainbow.
author: Proverb

lines: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
author: Willie Nelson

lines: Surely the day will come when color means nothing more than skin tone, when religion is seen uniquely as a way to speak one's soul; when birth places have the weight of a throw of the dice and all men are born free, when understanding breeds love and brotherhood.
author: Josephine Baker

lines: Moderation is the feebleness and sloth of the soul, whereas ambition is the warmth and activity of it.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: The world is moving so fast these days that the man who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.
author: Elbert Hubbard

lines: Shared joys make a friend, not shared sufferings.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: You should respect each other and refrain from disputes; you should not, like water and oil, repel each other, but should, like milk and water, mingle together.
author: Buddha

lines: One forgives to the degree that one loves.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: I would rather be able to appreciate things I can not have than to have things I am not able to appreciate.
author: Elbert Hubbard

lines: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: ... life is moral responsibility. Life is several other things, we do not deny. It is beauty, it is joy, it is tragedy, it is comedy, it is psychical and physical pleasure, it is the interplay of a thousand rude or delicate motions and emotions, it is the grimmest and the merriest motley of phantasmagoria that could appeal to the gravest or the maddest brush ever put to palette; but it is steadily and sturdily and always moral responsibility.
author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

lines: Treat the other man's faith gently; it is all he has to believe with.
author: Athenæus

lines: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
author: James Baldwin

lines: Hope, deceitful though it be, is at least of this good use to us that while we are traveling through this life, it conducts us by an easier and more pleasant way to our journey's end.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing that you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

lines: The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Commerce and justice are not divorceable notions.
author: Jeffrey Swartz

lines: A man who lacks reliability is utterly useless.
author: Confucius

lines: Anyone can carry his burden, however hard, until nightfall. Anyone can do his work, however hard, for one day. Anyone can live sweetly, patiently, lovingly, purely, till the sun goes down. And this is all life really means.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: He that has patience may compass anything.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: Never regret yesterday. Life is in you today, and you make your tomorrow.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

lines: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Love consists in this, that its own should be another's; to feel the joy of another as joy in oneself, that is loving.
author: Emanuel Swedenborg

lines: He who walks with the wise grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.
author: Proverb

lines: Your purpose may not always be obvious, but always remember that you do have a purpose.
author: Rodney Williams

lines: Nothing is more contagious than example, and no man does any exceeding good or exceeding ill but it spawns new deeds of the same kind. The good we imitate through emulation, the ill through the malignity of our nature, which shame keeps locked up, but example sets free.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: If you work for a man, in heaven's name work for him! If he pays you wages that supply you your bread and butter, work for him - speak well of him, think well of him, stand by him and stand by the institution he represents. I think if I worked for a man I would work for him. I would not work for him a part of the time, and the rest of the time work against him. I would give an undivided service or none. If put to the pinch, an ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
author: Elbert Hubbard

lines: The craving for equality can express itself either as a desire to pull everyone down to our own level or as a desire to raise ourselves up along with everyone else.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Neither fire nor wind, birth nor death can erase our good deeds.
author: Buddha

lines: I've always thought that a big laugh is a really loud noise from the soul saying, 'Ain't that the truth.'
author: Quincy Jones

lines: To live a life fulfilled reflect on the things you have with gratitude.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: Discipline isn't just punishing, forcing compliance or stamping out bad behavior. Rather, discipline has to do with teaching proper deportment, caring about others, controlling oneself and putting someone else's wishes before one's own when the occasion calls for it.
author: Lawrence Balter

lines: Old people love to give good advice to console themselves for no longer being able to set a bad example.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

lines: Creativity is a natural extension of our enthusiasm.
author: Earl Nightingale

lines: A will finds a way.
author: Orison Swett Marden

lines: To see what is right and not to do it is want of courage.
author: Confucius

lines: When you have once seen the glow of happiness on the face of a beloved person, you know that a man can have no vocation but to awaken that light on [all] the faces surrounding him.
author: Albert Camus

lines: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
author: Honore de  Balzac

lines: It is more shameful to distrust one's friends than to be deceived by them.
author: François Duc De La Rochefoucauld

lines: Religions are many and diverse, but reason and goodness are one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

lines: There is no investment you can make which will pay you so well as the effort to scatter sunshine and good cheer through your establishment.
author: Orison Swett Marden

lines: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

lines: Every heart that has beat strong and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: My responsibility to myself, my neighbors, my family and the human family is to try to tell the truth.
author: Toni Cade Bambara

lines: The world's people all share the earnest aspiration to have peace, stability, justice and cooperation.
author: Tran  Duc Luong

lines: Never does the human soul appear so strong and noble as when it forgoes revenge and dares to forgive injury.
author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin

lines: Life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity and stumble from defeat to defeat.
author: Anaïs Nin

lines: And he gave it for his opinion, that whoever could make two ears of corn, or two blades of grass, to grow upon a spot of ground where only one grew before, would deserve better of mankind, and do more essential service to his country, than the whole race of politicians put together.
author: Jonathan  Swift

lines: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Buddha

lines: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof.
author: Richard David Bach

lines:
I live to hold communion

With all that is divine,

To feel there is a union

'Twixt Nature's heart and mine.
author: George Linnaeus  Banks

lines: Happiness can be found in even the darkest of times, but only to those who remember to turn on the light.
author: Albus Dumbledore

lines: Security is not the meaning of my life. Great opportunities are worth the risk.
author: Shirley Hufstedler

lines: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.
author: Anaïs Nin

lines: Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
author: Jonathan  Swift

lines: A soul that is kind and intends justice discovers more than any sophist.
author: Sophocles

lines: The man who can drive himself further once the effort gets painful is the man who will win.
author: Roger Bannister

lines: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
author: Victor Hugo

lines: Each contact with a human being is so rare, so precious, one should preserve it.
author: Anaïs Nin

lines: Patience is a remedy for every sorrow.
author: Publius Syrus

lines: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

lines: Where hope grows, miracles blossom.
author: Elna Rae

lines: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.
author: Joel A. Barker

lines: Someone with their feet planted firmly on the ground has no hope of reaching the stars.
author: Kelsey Dunn

lines: Perseverance, secret of all triumphs.
author: Victor Hugo

lines: When you make a world tolerable for yourself, you make a world tolerable for others.
author: Anaïs Nin

lines: The tendency in modern civilization is to make the world uniform... Let the mind be universal. The individual should not be sacrificed.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

lines: But groundless hope, like unconditional love, is the only kind worth having.
author: John Perry Barlow

lines: Trust everybody, but cut the cards.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

lines: Each child is an adventure into a better life — an opportunity to change the old pattern and make it new.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

lines: Always give your best, never get discouraged, never be petty; always remember, others may hate you, but those who hate you don't win unless you hate them, and then you destroy yourself.
author: Richard Nixon

lines: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

lines: Willingness to compromise with others' ways of living and cooperation in common tasks, these make living happy and fruitful.
author: Sri Sathya Sai Baba

lines: ...there are persons who seem to have overcome obstacles and by character and perseverance to have risen to the top. But we have no record of the numbers of able persons who fall by the wayside, persons who, with enough encouragement and opportunity, might make great contributions.
author: Mary  Barnett Gilson

lines: I think of a hero as someone who understands the degree of responsibility that comes with his freedom.
author: Bob Dylan [Robert Allen Zimmerman]

lines: ...one of my motivating forces has been to recreate the world I know into a world I wish I could be in. Hence my optimism and happy endings.
author: Kristin Hunter

lines: As for courage and will we cannot measure how much of each lies within us, we can only trust there will be sufficient to carry through trials which may lie ahead.
author: Andre Norton

lines: Your thoughts, words and deeds are painting the world around you.
author: Jewel Diamond Taylor

lines: In union there is strength.
author: Aesop

lines: God gave us memory that we might have roses in December.
author: James M. Barrie

lines: A good cause can become bad if we fight for it with means that are indiscriminatingly murderous. A bad cause can become good if enough people fight for it in a spirit of comradeship and self-sacrifice. In the end it is how you fight, as much as why you fight, that makes your cause good or bad.
author: Freeman Dyson

lines: Thoughtfulness for others, generosity, modesty, and self-respect, are the qualities which make a real gentleman, or lady, as distinguished from the veneered article which commonly goes by that name.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

lines: The day the child realizes that all adults are imperfect he becomes an adolescent; the day he forgives them, he becomes an adult; the day he forgives himself he becomes wise.
author: Alden Nowlan

lines: The hope, and not the fact, of advancement, is the spur to industry.
author: Sir Henry Taylor

lines: We could learn a lot from crayons; some are sharp, some are pretty, some are dull, while others bright, some have weird names, but they all have learned to live together in the same box.
author: Unknown

lines: Make the decision, make it with confidence, and the world will be yours.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else.
author: James M. Barrie

lines: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace. The soul that knows it not, knows no release from little things; knows not the livid loneliness of fear.
author: Amelia Earhart

lines: Patience and tenacity of purpose are worth more than twice their weight of cleverness.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

lines: Don't let your failures define you--let them teach you.
author: Barack Obama

lines: Work without Hope draws nectar in a sieve, And Hope without an object cannot live.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

lines: A good friend is a connection to life, a tie to the past, a road to the future, the key to sanity in a totally insane world.
author: Lois Wyse

lines: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself.
author: Ethel Barrymore

lines: The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.
author: Amelia Earhart

lines: If only people would realize that moral principles are like measles...They have to be caught. And only the people who've got them can pass on the contagion.
author: Aldous Huxley

lines: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a certain poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. Because it's only when you hitch your wagon to something larger than yourself that you realize your true potential.
author: Barack Obama

lines: I stopped believing in Santa Claus at age six when my mother took me to see him in a store and he asked for my autograph.
author: Shirley Temple Black

lines: The highest of distinctions is service to others.
author: King George IV

lines: You must learn day by day, year by year, to broaden your horizon. The more things you love, the more you are interested in, the more you enjoy, the more you are indignant about, the more you have left when anything happens.
author: Ethel Barrymore

lines: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
author: Meister Eckhart [Johannes Eckhart]

lines: A community is like a ship; everyone ought to be prepared to take the helm.
author: Henrik Ibsen

lines: Here, with whitened hair, desires failing, strength ebbing out of him, with the sun gone down and with only the serenity and the calm warning of the evening star left to him, he drank to Life, to all it had been, to what it was, to what it would be. Hurrah!
author: Sean   O'Casey

lines: Self-reverence, self-knowledge, self-control: These three alone lead life to sovereign power.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

lines: How can I be useful, of what service can I be? There is something inside me, what can it be?
author: Unknown

lines: I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them.
author: Clara Barton

lines: Unheard of means it's only undreamed of yet; Impossible means it's just not yet done.
author: Julia Ecklar

lines: A good education is not so much one which prepares a man to succeed in the world, as one which enables him to sustain a failure.
author: Bernard Iddings Bell

lines: Do you wish to be great? Then begin by being. Do you desire to construct a vast and lofty fabric? Think first about the foundations of humility. The higher your structure is to be, the deeper must be its foundation.
author: Augustine  of Hippo

lines: The greater man the greater courtesy.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

lines: There is one thing one has to have: either a soul that is cheerful by nature, or a soul made cheerful by work, love, art, and knowledge.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Nothing splendid has ever been achieved except by those who dared believe that something inside them was superior to circumstance.
author: Bruce Barton

lines: There is no substitute for hard work.
author: Thomas Edison

lines: With love and patience, nothing is impossible.
author: Dr. Daisaku Ikeda

lines: ... to a poet, the human community is like the community of birds to a bird, singing to each other. Love is one of the reasons we are singing to one another, love of language itself, love of sound, love of singing itself, and love of the other birds.
author: Sharon Olds

lines: Stay where you are. Find your own Calcutta. Find the sick, the suffering, and the lonely right there where you are — in your own homes and in your own families, in your workplaces and in your schools. You can find Calcutta all over the world, if you have the eyes to see. Everywhere, wherever you go, you find people who are unwanted, unloved, uncared for, just rejected by society — completely forgotten, completely left alone.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Being rich of heart makes you wealthy beyond compare.
author: Rodney Williams

lines: Caring can be learned by all human beings, can be worked into the design of every life, meeting an individual need as well as a pervasive need in society.
author: Mary Catherine Bateson

lines: Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration. Accordingly a genius is often merely a talented person who has done all of his or her homework.
author: Thomas Edison

lines: A moment of patience in a moment of anger can help us avoid a thousand moments of sorrow.
author: Imam Ali (A.S.)

lines: My work is loving the world.
author: Mary Oliver

lines: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: The best part of life is not just surviving, but thriving with passion and compassion and humor and style and generosity and kindness.
author: Maya Angelou

lines: We are not what we know but what we are willing to learn.
author: Mary Catherine Bateson

lines: It is a blessed thing that in every age someone has had the individuality enough and courage enough to stand by his own convictions.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

lines: One of the annoying things about believing in free will and individual responsibility is the difficulty of finding somebody to blame your problems on. And when you do find somebody, it's remarkable how often his picture turns up on your driver's license.
author: P.J. O'Rourke

lines: The trouble is that rich people, well-to-do people, very often don't really know who the poor are; and that is why we can forgive them, for knowledge can only lead to love, and love to service. And so, if they are not touched by them, it's because they do not know them.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Tact is the ability to make a person see lightning without letting him feel the bolt.
author: Orlando A. Battista

lines: I haven't failed. I've found 10,000 ways that don't work.
author: Thomas Edison

lines: Every man who expresses an honest thought is a soldier in the army of intellectual liberty.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

lines: Effort is only effort when it begins to hurt.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

lines: Honesty and transparency make you vulnerable. Be honest and transparent anyway.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Our success as a nation is not measured by how many years we have governed or how many wars we have won. It is measured by the quality of life which we have created for the society that our ideals were founded upon.
author: Mathew Morgan

lines: Praise can be your most valuable asset as long as you don't aim it at yourself.
author: Orlando A. Battista

lines: To dream anything that you want to dream. That's the beauty of the human mind. To do anything that you want to do. That is the strength of the human will. To trust yourself to test your limits. That is the courage to succeed.
author: Bernard Edmonds

lines: He stands erect by bending over the fallen. He rises by lifting others.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

lines:
Watch your thoughts; for they become words.

Watch your words; for they become actions.

Watch your actions; for they become habits.

Watch your habits; for they become character.

Watch your character for it will become your destiny.
author: Frank Outlaw

lines: There is more hunger for love and appreciation in this world than for bread.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Emptiness is a symptom that you are not living creatively. You either have not goal that is important enough to you, or you are not using your talents and efforts in a striving toward an important goal.
author: Maxwell Maltz

lines: You can pretend to care, but you can't pretend to show up.
author: George L. Bell

lines: An error doesn't become a mistake until you refuse to correct it.
author: Orlando A. Battista

lines: Great minds have purposes, others have wishes.
author: Washington Irving

lines: We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort.
author: Jesse Owens

lines: It's not about how much you do, but how much love you put into what you do that counts.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Goals give you more than a reason to get up in the morning; they are an incentive to keep you going all day. Goals tend to tap the deeper resources and draw the best out of life.
author: Harvey Mackay

lines: He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
author: B. C. Forbes

lines: In necessary things, unity; in disputed things, liberty; in all things, charity.
author: Richard Baxter

lines: Good men prefer to be accountable.
author: Michael Edwards

lines: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.
author: Washington Irving

lines: Character is much easier kept than recovered.
author: Thomas Paine

lines: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: A sense of humor... is needed armor. Joy in one's heart and some laughter on one's lips is a sign that the person down deep has a pretty good grasp of life.
author: Hugh Sidey

lines: Success is nothing more or less than being who you want to be; progressing toward your ideal each day.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: It is thus tolerance that is the source of peace, and intolerance that is the source of disorder and squabbling.
author: Pierre Bayle

lines: Right actions in the future are the best apologies for bad actions in the past.
author: Tyron Edwards

lines: One man with courage makes a majority.
author: Andrew Jackson

lines: We have it in our power to change the world over.
author: Thomas Paine

lines: We can do no great things - only small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Heaven on Earth is a choice you must make, not a place we must find.
author: Dr. Wayne Dyer

lines: Try not to become a man of success but a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Never look down on anybody unless you're helping him up.
author: Jesse  Jackson

lines: I believe in the equality of man; and I believe that religious duties consist in doing justice, loving mercy, and endeavoring to make our fellow-creatures happy.
author: Thomas Paine

lines: Music is the effort we make to explain to ourselves how our brains work. We listen to Bach transfixed because this is listening to a human mind.
author: Lewis Thomas

lines: You bring out the best in yourself by looking for the best in others.
author: Gene Bedley

lines: We can't solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Any man worth his salt will stick up for what he believes right, but it takes a slightly better man to acknowledge instantly and without reservation that he is in error.
author: Andrew Jackson

lines: The world is my country, all mankind are my bethren, and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

lines: Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

lines: My grandfather once told me that there were two kinds of people: those who do the work and those who take the credit. He told me to try to be in the first group; there was much less competition.
author: Indira Gandhi

lines: Responsibility finds a way. Irresponsibilty makes excuses!
author: Gene Bedley

lines:
If you can't explain it simply, 

you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: We've removed the ceiling above our dreams. There are no more impossible dreams.
author: Jesse  Jackson

lines: The secret to mastery in any field is to forever be a student.
author: Martin   Palmer

lines: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
author: Arnold H. Glasgow

lines: At the end of your life, you will never regret not having passed one more test, not winning one more verdict, or not closing one more deal. You will regret time not spent with a husband, a friend, a child, or a parent.
author: Barbara Bush

lines: Compassion will cure more sins than condemnation.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

lines: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: We forget that every good that is worth possessing must be paid for in strokes of daily effort. We postpone and postpone, until those smiling possibilities are dead.
author: William James

lines: Never violate the sacredness of your individual self-respect.
author: Theodore  Parker

lines: The most I can do for my friend is simply to be his friend. I have no wealth to bestow on him. If he knows that I am happy in loving him, he will want no other reward. Is not friendship divine in this?
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Until you value yourself you will not value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it.
author: M. Scott Peck

lines: You don't have to accept the invitation to get angry. Instead, practice forgiveness, empathy and encouragement.
author: Dan Fallon

lines: Every man should keep a fair-sized cemetery in which to bury the faults of his friends.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

lines: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Live all you can - it's a mistake not to. It doesn't so much matter what you do in particular, so long as you have your life. If you haven't had that, what have you had?
author: Henry James

lines: Find out who you are and do it on purpose.
author: Dolly Parton

lines: The sacredness, if there is any, is all in yourself and not in the place.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: If you will think about what you ought to do for other people, your character will take care of itself. Character is a by-product, and any man who devotes himself to its cultivation in his own case will become a selfish prig.
author: Woodrow Wilson

lines: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
author: Brandan Francis Behan

lines: Nothing truly valuable arises from ambition or from a mere sense of duty; it stems rather from love and devotion towards men and towards objective things.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: To change one's life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly. No exceptions.
author: William James

lines: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.
author: Dolly Parton

lines: I am resolved that I will not through humility become the devil's attorney. I will endeavor to speak a good word for the truth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: The greatest discovery of my generation is that human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind.
author: William James

lines: The struggle alone pleases us, not the victory.
author: Blaise Pascal

lines: In short, I am convinced, both by faith and experience, that to maintain one's self on this earth is not a hardship but a pastime, if we will live simply and wisely; as the pursuits of the simpler nations are still the sports of the more artificial.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: If a man has any greatness in him, it comes to light, not in one flamboyant hour, but in the ledger of his daily work.
author: Beryl Markham

lines: Live your life from your heart. Share from your heart. And your story will touch and heal people's souls.
author: Melodie Beattie

lines: Courage is a special kind of knowledge: the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
author: David Ben-Gurion

lines: I think and think for months and years, ninety-nine times, the conclusion is false. The hundredth time I am right.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: ...religious experience, as we have studied it, cannot be cited as unequivocally supporting the infinitist belief. The only thing that it unequivocally testifies to is that we can experience union with something larger than ourselves and in that union find our greatest peace.
author: William James

lines: The strength of a man's virtue must not be measured by his efforts, but by his ordinary life.
author: Blaise Pascal

lines: If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost: that is where they should be. Now put the foundations under them.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: And still, after all this time, the Sun has never said to the Earth,‘You owe me.’ Look what happens with love like that. It lights up the sky.
author: Jalal ad-Din   Rumi

lines: These are days when no one should rely unduly on his “competence.” Strength lies in improvisation. All the decisive blows are struck left-handed.
author: Walter Benjamin

lines: Let every man be respected as an individual and no man idolized.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: The heart has reason which reason cannot understand.
author: Blaise Pascal

lines: Go confidently in the direction of our dreams! Live the life you've imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

lines: There is neither happiness nor unhappiness in this world; there is merely the comparison of one state to the other. Only a man who has felt ultimate despair is capable of feeling ultimate bliss.
author: Alexandre Dumas

lines: Happiness includes chiefly the idea of satisfaction after full honest effort. No one can possibly be satisfied and no one can be happy who feels that in some paramount affairs he failed to take up the challenge of life.
author: Arnold Bennett

lines: Relativity applies to physics, not ethics.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Whoever you are, whatever your dream, you have to be strong in your head and strong in your heart. Be strong. There's no quitting in the person who wants it bad enough.
author: Carly Patterson

lines: We are not what we are, nor do we treat or esteem each other for such, but for what we are capable of being.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: When the character of a man is not clear to you, look at his friends.
author: Japanese Proverb

lines: In the hour of adversity, be not without hope; for crystal rain falls from black clouds.
author: Nizami

lines:
You're off to Great Places!
Today is your day!
Your mountain is waiting,
So... get on your way!
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: There is incredible value in being of service to others.
author: Elizabeth Berg

lines: The most important human endeavor is striving for morality in our actions. Our inner balance and even our very existence depend on it. Only morality in our actions can give beauty and dignity to our lives.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: It is a great importance to set a resolution, not to be shaken, never to tell an untruth. There is no vice so mean, so pitiful, so contemptible and he who permits himself to tell a lie once, finds it much easier to do it a second and third time, till at length it becomes habitual, he tells lies without attending to it, and truths without the world's believing him. This falsehood of the tongue leads to that of the heart, and in time depraves all its good dispositions.
