author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: If a man does his best, what else is there?
author: George S. Patton

lines: There never is but one opportunity of a kind.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Every day you have the opportunity to learn and experience some-thing and some-one new. Seize the opportunity. Learn and experience everything you can, and use it to change the world.
author: Rodney Williams

lines: He to whom this emotion is a stranger, who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead: his eyes are closed.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Health, learning and virtue will ensure your happiness; they will give you a quiet conscience, private esteem and public honour.
author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: Tolerance is only complacence when it makes no distinction between right and wrong.
author: Sarah Patton Boyle

lines: If men could combine thus earnestly, and patiently, and harmoniously to some really worthy end, what might they not accomplish?
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: We must be willing to get rid of the life we’ve planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

lines: There is no beautifier of complexion, or form, or behavior, like the wish to scatter joy and not pain around us. ‘Tis good to give a stranger a meal, or a night’s lodging. ‘Tis better to be hospitable to his good meaning and thought, and give courage to a companion. We must be as courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lines: I'd rather be a could-be if I cannot be an are; because a could-be is a maybe who is reaching for a star. I'd rather be a has-been than a might-have-been, by far; for a might have-been has never been, but a has was once an are.
author: Milton Berle

lines: Great spirits have always found violent opposition from mediocre minds. The latter cannot understand it when a man does not thoughtlessly submit to hereditary prejudices but honestly and courageously uses his intelligence and fulfills the duty to express the results of his thoughts in clear form.`
author: Albert Einstein

lines: The happiest moments my heart knows are those in which it is pouring forth its affections to a few esteemed characters.
author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand.
author: Randy Pausch

lines: It is never too late to give up our prejudices.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
author: Dr. Wayne Dyer

lines: In each human heart are a tiger, a pig, an ass and a nightingale. Diversity of character is due to their unequal activity.
author: Ambrose Bierce

lines: True religion is real living; living with all one's soul, with all one's goodness and righteousness.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: The truth is that our finest moments are most likely to occur when we are feeling deeply uncomfortable, unhappy, or unfulfilled. For it is only in such moments, propelled by our discomfort, that we are likely to step out of our ruts and start searching for different ways or truer answers.
author: M. Scott Peck

lines: It is worth the while to live respectably unto ourselves. We can possibly get along with a neighbor, even with a bedfellow, whom we respect but very little; but as soon as it comes to this, that we do not respect ourselves, then we do not get along at all...
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Anyone can dabble, but once you've made that commitment, your blood has that particular thing in it, and it's very hard for people to stop you.
author: Bill Cosby

lines: Joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop off like autumn leaves.
author: John Muir

lines: The power of a movement lies in the fact that it can indeed change the habits of people. This change is not the result of force but of dedication, of moral persuasion.
author: Stephen Biko

lines: Not everything that counts can be counted, and not everything that can be counted counts.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: With faith, discipline and selfless devotion to duty, there is nothing worthwhile that you cannot achieve.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

lines: My actual life is a fact, in view of which I have no occasion to congratulate myself; but for my faith and aspiration I have respect. It is from these that I speak.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.
author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
author: Auguste Rodin

lines: Humility must always be the portion of any man who receives acclaim earned in the blood of his followers and the sacrifices of his friends.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

lines: Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.
author: Bible

lines: I wouldn't be human if I didn't feel pride and something that transcends pride humility.
author: James Cash Penney

lines: The world rests on principles.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: There is a destiny that makes us brothers, No one goes his way alone; All that we send into the lives of others, Comes back into our own.
author: Edwin Markham

lines: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
author: Josh Billings [Henry Wheeler Shaw]

lines: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

lines: Children are apt to live up to what you believe of them.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

lines: Learning is what most adults will do for a living in the 21st century.
author: Alfred Edward Perlman

lines: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Though God hath raised me high, yet this I count the glory of my crown: that I have reigned with your loves. And though you have had, and may have, many mightier and wiser princes sitting in this seat; yet you never had, nor shall have any that will love you better.
author: Queen Elizabeth I

lines: Love is patient, Love is Kind, it does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud.
author: Bible

lines: It is a very delicate job to forgive a man, without lowering him in his own estimation, and yours too.
author: Josh Billings [Henry Wheeler Shaw]

lines: Charity activities are the force which gives our life meaning.
author: Mazhar El Shorbagi

lines: There can be no friendship without confidence, and no confidence without integrity.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: Success is focusing the full power of all you are on what you have a burning desire to achieve.
author: Wilferd A. Peterson

lines: I think that we may safely trust a good deal more than we do. We may waive just so much care of ourselves as we honestly bestow elsewhere. Nature is as well adapted to our weakness as to our strength.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing, there is a field. I will meet you there.
author: Jalal ad-Din   Rumi

lines: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
author: Joseph Campbell

lines: There is no problem unless we choose to make it one, so think carefully before you act.
author: David Marshall

lines: A smile starts on the lips, A grin spreads to the eyes, A chuckle comes from the belly; But a good laugh bursts forth from the soul, Overflows, and bubbles all around.
author: Carolyn Birmingham

lines:
What life have you if you have not life together?

There is no life that is not in community.
author: T.S. Eliot

lines: If a man does not make new acquaintance as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, Sir, should keep his friendship in constant repair.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: Now the alternative to despair is courage. And human life can be viewed as a continuous struggle between these two options. Courage is the capacity to affirm one's life in spite of the elements which threaten it. The fact that courage usually predominates over despair in itself tells us something important about life. It tells you that the forces that affirm life are stronger than those that negate it.
author: Paul E. Pfuetze

lines: We belong to the community. It is not the tailor alone who is the ninth part of a man; it is as much the preacher, and the merchant, and the farmer. Where is this division of labor to end? and what object does it finally serve? No doubt another may also think for me; but it is not therefore desirable that he should do so to the exclusion of my thinking for myself.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: World peace, like community peace, does not require that each man love his neighbor -- it requires only that they live together with mutual tolerance, submitting their disputes to a just and peaceful settlement.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: You are Braver than you Believe, Smarter than you Seem, and Stronger than you Think.
author: Winnie the Pooh

lines:
We shall not cease from exploration;

And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started, and know the place for the first time.
author: T.S. Eliot

lines: What we hope ever to do with ease, we must learn first to do with diligence.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: This is the first test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
author: William Lyon Phelps

lines: Commitment means that it is possible for a man to yield the nerve center of his consent to a purpose or cause, a movement or an ideal, which may be more important to him than whether he lives or dies.
author: Howard Thurman

lines: You're alive. Do something. The directive in life, the moral imperative was so uncomplicated. It could be expressed in single words, not complete sentences. It sounded like this: Look. Listen. Choose. Act.
author: Barbara Hall

lines: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
author: William Blake

lines: Friendship is the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person, having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people.
author: Spencer Johnson

lines: Physical bravery is an animal instinct; moral bravery is much higher and truer courage.
author: Wendell Phillips

lines: Tolerance and celebration of individual differences is the fire that fuels lasting love.
author: Tom Hannah

lines: I appreciate people who are civil, whether they mean it or not. I think: Be civil. Do not cherish your opinion over my feelings. There's a vanity to candor that isn't really worth it. Be kind.
author: Richard Greenberg

lines: Tomorrow do thy worst, I have lived today.
author: John Dryden

lines: The real community of man...is the community of those who seek the truth, of the potential knowers.
author: Allan Bloom

lines: Perhaps the most delightful friendships are those in which there is much agreement, much disputation, and yet more personal liking.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: Hope is itself a species of happiness, and, perhaps, the chief happiness which this world affords: but, like all other pleasures immoderately enjoyed, the excesses of hope must be expiated by pain; and expectations improperly indulged must end in disappointment.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: Pure love is a willingness to give without a thought of receiving anything in return.
author: Peace Pilgrim

lines: It is the formidable character of the species to routinely seek the improbable, the difficult, even the impossible, as a source of pleasure and self-justification. Who would try to write poems, or novels, or paint pictures unless he is an optimist?
author: Lionel Tiger

lines: The vision that you glorify in your mind, the ideal that you enthrone in your heart - this you will build your life by, and this you will become.
author: James Allen

lines: The failure to read good books both enfeebles the vision and strengthens our most fatal tendency — the belief that the here and now is all there is.
author: Allan Bloom

lines: Most of us who turn to any subject we love remember some morning or evening hour when we…sat with parted lips listening to a new talker, or for very lack of books began to listen to the voices within, as the first traceable beginning of our love.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
author: Edgar Allen Poe

lines: The first duty of love is to listen.
author: Paul Tillich

lines: As you become more clear about who you really are, you'll be better able to decide what is best for you - the first time around.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
author: Bruce Lee

lines: To meet at all, one must open ones eyes to another; and there is no true conversation no matter how many words are spoken, unless the eye, unveiled and listening, opens itself to the other.
author: Jessamyn West

lines: Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
author: Paul Boese

lines: The important work of moving the world forward does not wait to be done by perfect men.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: If your determination is fixed, I do not counsel you to despair. Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but perseverance.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: We should therefore claim, in the name of tolerance, the right not to tolerate the intolerant.
author: Karl Popper

lines: In democratic ages men rarely sacrifice themselves for another, but they show a general compassion for all the human race. One never sees them inflict pointless suffering, and they are glad to relieve the sorrows of others when they can do so without much trouble to themselves. They are not disinterested, but they are gentle.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

lines: We can all be angels to one another. We can choose to obey the still small stirring within, the little whisper that says, 'Go. Ask. Reach out. Be an answer to someone's plea. You have a part to play. Have faith.' We can decide to risk that He is indeed there, watching, caring, cherishing us as we love and accept love. The world will be a better place for it. And wherever they are, the angels will dance.
author: Joan Wester Anderson

lines: You have only always to do what is right. It will become easier by practice, and you enjoy in the midst of your trials the pleasure of an approving conscience.
author: Robert E. Lee

lines: Courage is about doing what you're afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you're scared.
author: Eddie   Rickenbacker

lines: Failure after long perseverance is much grander than never to have a striving good enough to be called a failure.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: It is better to suffer wrong than to do it, and happier to be sometimes cheated than not to trust.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

lines: The healthiest competition occurs when average people win by putting above average effort.
author: Colin Powell

lines: I ain't never been poor--just broke. Being poor is a state of mind; whereas, being broke is just a temporary situation.
author: Mike Todd

lines: For the strength of the Pack is the Wolf, and the strength of the Wolf is the Pack.
author: Rudyard Kipling

lines: That you may retain your self-respect, it is better to displease the people by doing what you know is right, than to temporarily please them by doing what you know is wrong.
author: William J.H. Boetcker

lines: No soul is desolate as long as there is a human being for whom it can feel trust and reverence.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: The greatest ability is dependability.
author: Robert "Bob" Jones

lines: The freedom to be your best means nothing unless you are willing to do your best.
author: Colin Powell

lines: The world can only change from within.
author: Eckhart Tolle

lines: While the spirit of neighborliness was important on the frontier because neighbors were so few, it is even more important now because our neighbors are so many.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

lines: The first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: Decide what you want.
author: Ben Stein

lines: A resolute determination is the truest wisdom.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

lines: When one sits in the Hoop Of The People, one must be responsible because all of Creation is related. And the hurt of one is the hurt of all. And the honor of one is the honor of all. And whatever we do affects everything in the universe.
author: Black Elk [Hehaka Sapa]

lines: What I would like to give my daughter is freedom. And this is something that must be given by example, not by exhortation.
author: Erica Jong

lines: I am of the opinion that my life belongs to the whole community and as long as I live, it is my privilege to do for it whatever I can. I want to be thoroughly used up when I die, for the harder I work the more I live.
author: George Bernard Shaw

lines: It is the nature of the strong heart, that like the palm tree it strives ever upwards when it is most burdened.
author: Sir Philip Sidney

lines: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

lines: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
author: Walter Elliott

lines: Animals don't hate, and we're supposed to be better than them.
author: Elvis Presley

lines: Never consider the possibility of failure; as long as you persist, you will be successful.
author: Brian Tracy

lines: We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men.
author: Herman Melville

lines: What is defeat? Nothing but education; nothing but the first step to something better.
author: Wendell Phillips

lines: In ordinary life we hardly realize that we receive a great deal more than we give, and that it is only with gratitude that life becomes rich.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

lines: There are other measures of self-respect for a man, than the number of clean shirts he puts on every day.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: I can accept failure, but I can't accept not trying.
author: Michael Jordan

lines: We live by our genius for hope; we survive by our talent for dispensing with it.
author: V.S. Pritchett

lines: There's much to be said for challenging fate instead of ducking behind it.
author: Diana Trilling

lines: The strongest bond of human sympathy outside the family relation should be one uniting working people of all nations and tongues and kindreds.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: When there is no where else to turn, turn inward. Enter into the sacred silence of your soul and ask for healing, guidance and personal peace.
author: Michaiel Bovenes

lines: When we talk about understanding, surely it takes place only when the mind listens completely -- the mind being your heart, your nerves, your ears- when you give your whole attention to it.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

lines: The essence of optimism is that it takes no account of the present, but it is a source of inspiration, of vitality and hope where others have resigned; it enables a man to hold his head high, to claim the future for himself and not to abandon it to his enemy.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

lines: Character wants room; must not be crowded on by persons, nor be judged from glimpses got in the press of affairs, or on few occasions. It needs perspective, as a great building.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Your soul...is a dark forest. But the trees are of a particular species, they are genealogical trees.
author: Marcel Proust

lines: It is a grand thing to rise in the world. The ambition to do so is the very salt of the earth. It is the parent of all enterprise, and the cause of all improvement.
author: Anthony Trollope

lines: Community means strength that joins our strength to do the work that needs to be done. Arms to hold us when we falter. A circle of healing. A circle of friends. Someplace where we can be free.
author: Starhawk

lines: Our soul desires to be understanding, our ego is only concerned with being understood. When you are being understanding you are connected to your soul.
author: Michaiel Bovenes

lines: Someday all you’ll have to light the way will be a single ray of hope, and that will be enough.
author: Kobi Yamada

lines: The courage to imagine the otherwise is our greatest resource, adding color and suspense to all our life.
author: Daniel Boorstin

lines: Character is higher than intellect. Thinking is the function. Living is the functionary. The stream retreats to its source. A great soul will be strong to live, as well as strong to think.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: We must exchange the philosophy of excuse - what I am is beyond my control - for the philosophy of responsibility.
author: Barbara Charline Jordan

lines: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
author: Marcel Proust

lines: It takes a noble man to plant a seed for a tree that will some day give shade to people he may never meet.
author: D. Elton Trueblood

lines: The good we secure for ourselves is precarious and uncertain until it is secured for all of us and incorporated into our common life.
author: Jane Addams

lines: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.
author: Ann Landers

lines: In the final analysis, there is no other solution to a man's problems but the day's honest work, the day's honest decisions, the day's generous utterance, and the day's good deed.
author: Claire Booth Luce

lines: Success or failure depends more upon attitude than upon capacity...successful men act as though they have accomplished or are enjoying something. Soon it becomes reality. Act, look, feel successful, conduct yourself accordingly, and you will be amazed at the positive results.
author: DuPree Jordan, Jr.

lines: What is permissible is not always honorable.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

lines: When our eyes see our hands doing the work of our hearts, the circle of Creation is completed inside us, the doors of our souls fly open and love steps forth to heal everything in sight.
author: Michael Bridge

lines: In the matter of religion, people eagerly fasten their eyes on the difference between their own creed and yours; whilst the charm of the study is in finding the agreements and identities in all the religions of humanity.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

lines: Even a toad has four ounces of strength.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: I believe that no characteristic is so distinctively human as the sense of indebtedness we feel, not necessarily for a favor received, but even for the slightest evidence of kindness; and there is nothing so boorish, savage, inhuman as to appear to be overwhelmed by a favor, let alone unworthy of it.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

lines: No one can whistle a symphony. It takes a whole orchestra to play it.
author: Halford E. Luccock

lines: Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence.
author: Hal Borland

lines: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: A little less hypocrisy and a little more tolerance towards oneself can only have good results in respect for our neighbor; for we are all too prone to transfer to our fellows the injustice and violence we inflict upon our own natures.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

lines: Loving parents have caring children.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: One piece of log creates a small fire, adequate to warm you up, add just a few more pieces to blast an immense bonfire, large enough to warm up your entire circle of friends; needless to say that individuality counts but team work dynamites.
author: Jin Kwon

lines: There are two ways of meeting difficulties. You alter the difficulties or you alter yourself to meet them.
author: Phyllis Bottome

lines: Your vision will become clear only when you look into your heart. Those who look outside, dream. Those who looks inside, awaken.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

lines: If you wish your merit to be known, acknowledge that of other people.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: People without firmness of character love to make up a fate for themselves; that relieves them of the necessity of having their own will and of taking responsibility for themselves.
author: Ivan Turgenev

lines: No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the continent.
author: John   Donne

lines: Trials, temptations, disappointments -- all these are helps instead of hindrances, if one uses them rightly. They not only test the fiber of character but strengthen it...Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before.
author: James Buckham

lines: Whatever we possess becomes of double value when we have the opportunity of sharing it with others.
author: Jean-Nicolas Bouilly

lines: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising which tempt you to believe that your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to the end, requires some of the same courage which a soldier needs.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: An understanding heart is everything in a teacher, and cannot be esteemed highly enough. One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feeling. The curriculum is so much necessary raw material, but warmth is the vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

lines: To understand all is to forgive all.
author: French Proverb

lines: Worrying is like a rocking chair, it gives you something to do, but it gets you nowhere.
author: Glen Turner

lines: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family. Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
author: Jane Howard

lines: If you can't have faith in what is held up to you for faith, you must find things to believe in yourself, for a life without faith in something is too narrow a space to live.
author: Alec Bourne

lines: The best lightning rod for your protection is your own spine.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Humility provides everyone, even him who despairs in solitude, with the strongest relationship to his fellow man, and this immediately, though, of course, only in the case of complete and permanent humility.
author: Frank Kafka

lines: There's a difference between interest and commitment. When you're interested in doing something, you do it only when circumstance permit. When you're committed to something, you accept no excuses, only results.
author: Art Turock

lines: Sticks in a bundle are unbreakable.
author: Kenyan Proverb

lines: Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising, which tempt you to believe that your critics are right. To Map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires courage.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: By imposing too great a responsibility, or rather, all responsibility, on yourself, you crush yourself.
author: Frank Kafka

lines: When eating bamboo sprouts, remember the man who planted them.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: None of us is as smart as all of us.
author: Ken  Blanchard

lines: There is not enough darkness in all the world to put out the light of even one small candle.
author: Robert Alden

lines: There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.
author: Ray Bradbury

lines: In the uttermost meaning of the words, thought is devout, and devotion is thought. Deep calls unto deep.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Feet, why do I need them if I have wings to fly?
author: Frida Kahlo

lines: They are not poor that have little, but they that desire much. The richest man, whatever his lot, is the one who's content with his lot.
author: Dutch Proverb

lines: The miracle, or the power, that elevates the few is to be found in their industry, application, and perseverance under the prompting of a brave, determined spirit.
author: Mark Twain

lines: It is amazing how much you can accomplish when it doesn't matter who gets the credit.
author: Unknown

lines: I do not wish to treat friendships daintily, but with the roughest courage. When they are real, they are not glass threads or frost-work, but the solidest thing we know.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Toughness is in the soul and spirit, not in muscles.
author: Alex Karras

lines: If you can't reward then you should thank.
author: Arabic Proverb

lines: Loyalty to petrified opinions never yet broke a chain or freed a human soul in this world — and never will.
author: Mark Twain

lines: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
author: William Penn

lines: Maintain composure in times of heightened emotion, reacting only when thoughts are calm and clear. Being sensible will open doors for solutions and creativity.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

lines: There is overwhelming evidence that the higher the level of self-esteem, the more likely one will be to treat others with respect, kindness, and generosity.
author: Nathaniel Branden

lines: A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him, I may think aloud.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow.
author: Helen Keller

lines: If there is no wind, row.
author: Latin Proverb

lines: There can be no defense like elaborate courtesy.
author: Edward V. Lucas

lines: A leader is someone who demonstrates what's possible.
author: Mark Yarnell

lines: Sometimes the most important thing in a whole day is the rest we take between two deep breaths.
author: Etty Hillesum

lines: Action and reaction, ebb and flow, trial and error, change - this is the rhythm of living. Out of our over-confidence, fear; out of our fear, clearer vision, fresh hope. And out of hope, progress.
author: Bruce Barton

lines: Scientists study the world how it is now, but engineers take a paint brush and create a world that has never been before.
author: Asher Brandley

lines: Our chief want in life, is, someone who shall make us do what we can. This is the service of a friend. With him we are easily great.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: One can never consent to creep when one feels the copmpulsion to soar.
author: Helen Keller

lines: Slander cannot destroy an honest man when the flood recedes the rock is there.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Forgiveness is the fragrance the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
author: Mark Twain

lines: After all these years, I am still involved in the process of self-discovery. It's better to explore life and make mistakes than to play it safe. Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life.
author: Sophia Loren

lines: Count no day lost in which you waited your turn, took only your share and sought advantage over no one.
author: Robert Brault

lines: The reward of a thing well done, is to have done it.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature... Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

lines: Be honorable yourself if you wish to associate with honorable people.
author: Welsh Proverb

lines: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did so. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
author: Mark Twain

lines: We must meet the challenge rather than wish it were not before us.
author: William J. Brennan, Jr.

lines: Arrogance invites ruin; humility receives benefits.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: My kind of loyalty was loyalty to one's country, not to...its office holders.
author: Mark Twain

lines: Nobody trips over mountains. It is the small pebble that causes you to stumble. Pass all the pebbles in your path and you will find that you have crossed the mountain.
author: Unknown

lines: Vision is not enough, it must be combined with venture. It is not enough to stare up the steps, we must step up the stairs.
author: Vaclav Havel

lines: It's the constant and determined effort that breaks down all resistance, sweeps away all obstacles.
author: Claude M. Briston

lines: Let not the tie be mercenary, though the service is measured in money. Make yourself necessary to somebody. Do not make life hard to any.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: When helping others, do not look for a reward; if you are looking for rewards, don't help others.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Independence is loyalty to one's best self and principles, and this is often disloyalty to the general idols and fetishes.
author: Mark Twain

lines: Sacrifices are concerned with the feelings of devotion and longing.
author: Xun Zi

lines: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship we must love friends for their sake rather than our own.
author: Charlotte Brontë

lines: This insight, which expresses itself by what is called Imagination, is a very high sort of seeing.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy, and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
author: Helen Keller

lines: When you were born, you cried and the world rejoiced. Live your life in such a manner that when you die, the world cries and you rejoice.
author: Indian Proverb

lines: A habit cannot be tossed out the window; it must be coaxed down the stairs a step at a time.
author: Mark Twain

lines: There is always the danger that we may just do the work for the sake of the work. This is where the respect and the love and the devotion come in - that we do it to God, to Christ, and that's why we try to do it as beautifully as possible.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: I cannot look back with regrets, but I can look forward optimistically.
author: Cornelius Kilgore

lines: Behold the turtle. He only makes progress when he sticks his neck out.
author: James Bryant  Conant

lines: If I could I would always work in silence and obscurity, and let my efforts be known by their results.
author: Emily Brontë

lines: The three qualities necessary for training: Great faith. Great doubt. Great effort.
author: Zen Proverb

lines: Always do right - this will gratify some and astonish the rest.
author: Mark Twain

lines: I learned that landscape by drawing it, and I came to care for it with a lover's devotion.
author: Philip Pullman

lines: A mistake is a crash-course in learning.
author: BIlly Anderson

lines: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Brontë

lines: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

lines: Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
author: Mark Twain

lines: I really owe everything to my parents and their devotion and drive to see to it that their children had the education which led to the opportunities that they never were able to have.
author: George J. Mitchell

lines: To finish the moment, to find the journey's end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom...Since our office is with moments, let us husband them.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: He who is afraid to ask is ashamed of learning.
author: Danish Proverb

lines: It were not best that we should all think alike; it is difference of opinion that makes horse races.
author: Mark Twain

lines: There are realities we all share, regardless of our nationality, language, or individual tastes. As we need food, so do we need emotional nourishment: love, kindness, appreciation, and support from others. We need to understand our environment and our relationship to it. We need to fulfill certain inner hungers: the need for happiness, for peace of mind -- for wisdom.
author: Swami Kriyananda [J. Donald Walters]

lines: Society is joint action and cooperation in which each participant sees the other partner's success as a means for the attainment of his own.
author: Ludwig von Mises

lines: Genius is nothing but a great capacity for patience.
author: Georges-Louis Leclerc Buffon

lines: Choose to chance the rapids and dare to dance the skies.
author: Garth  Brooks

lines: The magnanimous know very well that they who give time, or money, or shelter, to the stranger — so it be done for love, and not for ostentation — do, as it were, put God under obligation to them, so perfect are the compensations of the universe.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Listen not merely to what is said but to the tone of voice in which it is said.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: I have three precious things which I hold fast and prize. The first is gentleness; the second is frugality; the third is humility, which keeps me from putting myself before others. Be gentle and you can be bold; be frugal and you can be liberal; avoid putting yourself before others and you can become a leader among men.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: My humanity is bound up in yours, for we can only be human together.
author: Archbishop Desmond Tutu

lines: Despair shows us the limit of our imagination. Imaginations shared create collaboration, and collaboration creates community, and community inspires social change.
author: Terry Tempest Williams

lines: An imagination is a powerful tool. It can tint memories of the past, shade perceptions of the present, or paint a future so vivid that it can entice...or terrify, all depending upon how we conduct ourselves today.
author: James Robert "Jim" Davis

lines: I still miss those I loved who are no longer with me but I find I am grateful for having loved them. The gratitude has finally conquered the loss.
author: Rita Mae Brown

lines: Open the doors of opportunity to talent and virtue and they will do themselves justice.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: And children whose backgrounds have stunted their sense of the future need to be taught by example that they are good for more than they dared dream.
author: Kenneth Keniston

lines: If a wind blows, ride it!
author: Arabic Proverb

lines: To love someone deeply gives you strength. Being loved by someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: Frequently people think compassion and love are merely sentimental. No! They are very demanding. If you are going to be compassionate, be prepared for action.
author: Archbishop Desmond Tutu

lines: The art of being yourself at your best is the art of unfolding your personality into the person you want to be...Be gentle with yourself, learn to love yourself, to forgive yourself, for only as we have the right attitude toward ourselves can we have the right attitude toward others.
author: Wilferd A. Peterson

lines: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

lines: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
author: Rita Mae Brown

lines: To him who is determined it remains only to act.
author: Italian  Proverb

lines: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
author: Sun Tzu

lines: Although we are in different boats you in your boat and we in our canoe we share the same river of life.
author: Chief Oren Lyons

lines: Wherever there is a human in need, there is an opportunity for kindness and to make a difference.
author: Kevin  Heath

lines: Live so that when your children think of fairness and integrity, they think of you.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

lines: Life is unnecessarily long. Moments of insight, of fine personal relation, a smile, a glance -- what ample borrowers of eternity they are!
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: Don't let slip an opportunity; it may never come again.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Be careful what you water your dreams with. Water them with worry and fear and you will produce weeds that choke the life from your dream. Water them with optimism and solutions and you will cultivate success.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: Difference is of the essence of humanity. Difference is an accident of birth and it should therefore never be the source of hatred or conflict. The answer to difference is to respect it. Therein lies a most fundamental principle of peace: respect for diversity.
author: John Hume

lines: Don't waste life in doubts and fears; spend yourself on the work before you, well assured that the right performance of this hour's duties will be the best preparation for the hours and ages that will follow it.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Obstinacy in a bad cause is but constancy in a good.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

lines: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

lines: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: At bottom every man knows well enough that he is a unique being, only once on this earth; and by no extraordinary chance will such a marvelously picturesque piece of diversity in unity as he is, ever be put together a second time.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Peace holds within itself trust in the Lord, the trust that He governs all things and provides all things, and that He leads towards an end that is good.
author: Emanuel Swedenborg

lines: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; unbelief, in denying them.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: It is from numberless diverse acts of courage and belief that human history is shaped. Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring, those ripples build a current that can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

lines: With time and patience the mulberry leaf becomes a silk gown.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: [People] may be said to resemble not the bricks of which a house is built, but the pieces of a picture puzzle, each differing in shape, but matching the rest, and thus bringing out the picture.
author: Felix  Adler

lines: Life is just a chance to grow a soul.
author: A. Powell Davies

lines: Rough diamonds may sometimes be mistaken for worthless pebbles.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

lines: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us, or we find it not.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: A handfull of patience is worth a bushel of brains.
author: Dutch Proverb

lines: You are as young as your faith, as old as your doubt; as young as your self-confidence, as old as your fear, as young as your hope, as old as your despair.
author: Samuel Ullman

lines: We have become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.
author: Jimmy Carter

lines: ...the day will come when man will recognize woman as his peer, not only at the fireside but in the councils of the nation. Then, and not until then, will there be the perfect comradeship, the ideal union, between the sexes that shall result in the highest development of the race.
author: Susan Brownell Anthony

lines: Always do what you are afraid to do.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: There are those who look at things the way they are, and ask why... I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?
author: Robert F. Kennedy

lines: Lack of patience in small matters can create havoc in great ones.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Cancer can take away all of my physical abilities. It cannot touch my mind, it cannot touch my heart, and it cannot touch my soul. And those three things are going to carry on forever.
author: Jimmy Valvano

lines: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
author: Nelson Mandela

lines: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.
author: Paul Bryant

lines: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly and they will show themselves great.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: He who knows patience knows peace.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they've got a second. Give your dreams all you've got and you'll be amazed at the energy that comes out of you.
author: William James

lines: In a mood of faith and hope my work goes on. A ream of fresh paper lies on my desk waiting for the next book. I am a writer and I take up my pen to write.
author: Pearl S.  Buck

lines: Man was born rich, or inevitably grows rich by the use of his faculties; by the union of thought with nature.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help made the world safe for diversity.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: Patience: To wait with certainity; the art of allowing life to carry you.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Happiness is inward, and not outward; and so, it does not depend on what we have, but on what we are.
author: Henry van Dyke

lines: No horse gets anywhere until he is harnessed. No stream or gas drives anything until it is confined. No Niagara is ever turned into light and power until it is tunneled. No life ever grows great until it is focused, dedicated, disciplined.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

lines: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
author: Agatha Christie

lines: To serve is beautiful, but only if it is done with joy and a whole heart and a free mind.
author: Pearl S.  Buck

lines: The highest vocation we can have is Love. Love in action is service.
author: Ken Essien

lines: The unity of freedom has never relied on uniformity of opinion.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: One may go a long way after one is tired.
author: French Proverb

lines: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
author: Vincent Van Gogh

lines: Happiness comes more from loving than being loved; and often when our affection seems wounded it is only our vanity bleeding. To love, and to be hurt often, and to love again -- this is the brave and happy life.
author: J. E. Buckrose

lines: Listening to someone talk isn't at all like listening to their words played over on a machine. What you hear when you have a face before you is never what you hear when you have before you a winding tape.
author: Oriana Fallaci

lines: The wave of the future is not the conquest of the world by a single dogmatic creed but the liberation of the diverse energies of free nations and free men.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

lines: Love life and life will love you back. Love people and they will love you back.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

lines: I have heard there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead and some come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready you see. Now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: The life I touch for good or ill will touch another life, and that in turn another, until who knows where the trembling stops or in what far place my touch will be felt.
author: Frederick Buechner

lines: Relationships of trust depend on our willingness to look not only to our own interests, but also the interests of others.
author: Peter Farquharson

lines: Believe in yourself and there will come a day when others will have no choice but to believe with you.
author: Cynthia Kersey

lines: Persistence can grind an iron beam down into a needle.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

lines: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

lines: When a person is down in the world, an ounce of help is better than a pound of preaching.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

lines: I believe that man will not merely endure: he will prevail. He is immortal, not because he alone among creatures has an inexhaustible voice, but because he has a soul, a spirit capable of compassion and sacrifice and endurance.
author: William Faulkner

lines: The beautiful thing about learning is nobody can take it away from you.
author: B. B. King

lines: Prepare the umbrella before it rains.
author: Malay Proverb

lines: Friends broaden our horizons. They serve as new models with whom we can identify. They allow us to be ourselves--and accept us that way. They enhance our self-esteem because they think we're okay, because we matter to them. And because they matter to us-for various reasons, at various levels of intensity-they enrich the quality of our emotional life.
author: Judith Viorst

lines: Sincere forgiveness isn't colored with expectations that the other person apologize or change. Don't worry whether or not they finally understand you. Love them and release them. Life feeds back truth to people in its own way and time
author: Sara Paddison

lines: We shouldn't teach great books; we should teach a love of reading.
author: B. F. Skinner

lines: A good heart is better than all the heads in the world.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

lines: We all need to know what it means to be honest. Honesty is more than not lying. It is truth telling, truth speaking, truth living, and truth loving.
author: James E. Faust

lines: Education is the one thing that no one can take from you.
author: B. B. King

lines: He who wants a rose must respect the thorn.
author: Persian Proverb

lines: Arise, awake, and stop not until the goal is achieved.
author: Swami Vivekananda

lines: Without forgiveness, there's no future.
author: Archbishop Desmond Tutu

lines: Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you're kind, amazing things will happen.
author: Conan  O'Brien

lines: Most of our obstacles would melt away if, instead of cowering before them, we should make up our minds to walk boldly through them.
author: Orison Swett Marden

lines: The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you.
author: B. B. King

lines: You have a clean slate every day you wake up. You have a chance every single morning to make that change and be the person you want to be. You just have to decide to do it. Decide today's the day. Say it; This is going to be my day.
author: Brendon Burchard

lines: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others let go.
author: William Feather

lines: We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love. There is some good in the worst of us and some evil in the best of us.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: If you want to be respected, you must respect yourself.
author: Spanish Proverb

lines: Success flourishes only in perseverance--ceaseless, restless perseverance.
author: Baron Manfred von Richthofen

lines: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
author: Voltaire

lines: Manners are of more importance than laws. Manners are what vex or soothe, corrupt or purify, exalt or debase, barbarize or refine us, by a constant, steady, uniform, insensible operation, like that of the air we breathe in.
author: Edmund Burke

lines: I fear no one, but I respect everyone.
author: Roger Federer

lines: Forgiveness is not an occasional act: it is an attitude.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: The young should be treated with respect.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Failing to prepare is like preparing to fail.
author: John R. Wooden

lines: If a man does not know what port he is steering for, no wind is favorable to him.
author: Seneca

lines: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

lines: There is no end. There is no beginning. There is only the infinite passion of life.
author: Federico Fellini

lines: One may be old in years, but not in spirit, or poor in wealth, but not in ambition.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Where there is life, there is hope. Where there are hopes, there are dreams. Where there are vivid dreams repeated, they become goals. Goals become the action plans and game plans that winners dwell on in intricate detail, knowing that achievement is almost automatic when the goal becomes an inner commitment. The response to the challenges of life—purpose—is the healing balm that enables each of us to face up to adversity and strife.
author: Dennis Waitley

lines: When bad men combine, the good must associate; else they will fall, one by one, an unpitied sacrifice in a contemptible struggle.
author: Edmund Burke

lines: Set your expectations high; find men and women whose integrity and values you respect; get their agreement on a course of action; and give them your ultimate trust.
author: John Fellows Akers

lines: If a man is called to be a streetsweeper, he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted, or Beethoven played music, or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, here lived a great streetsweeper who did his job well.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Man has responsibility, not power.
author: Tuscarora Proverb

lines: The reason most people never reach their goals is that they don't define them, learn about them, or even seriously consider them as believable or achievable.
author: Dennis Waitley

lines: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving much advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a gentle and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares.
author: Henri Nouwen

lines: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
author: Carol Burnett

lines: The words of kindness are more healing to a drooping heart than balm or honey.
author: Sarah Fielding

lines: Life's most urgent question is: What are you doing for others?
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: By learning you will teach, by teaching you will learn.
author: Latin Proverb

lines: Success is almost totally dependent upon drive and persistence. The extra energy required to make another effort or try another approach is the secret of winning.
author: Dennis Waitley

lines: We all need friends with whom we can speak of our deepest concerns, and who do not fear to speak the truth in love to us.
author: Margaret Guenther

lines: Failure is no more a permanent condition than success! For even if you succeed, there’s still another test.
author: Gene Bedley

lines: Greatness is more than potential. It is the execution of that potential. Beyond the raw talent. You need the appropriate training. You need the discipline. You need the inspiration. You need the drive.
author: Eric A. Burns

lines: If you lose hope, somehow you lose the vitality that keeps life moving, you lose that courage to be, that quality that helps you go on in spite of it all.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Personal example carries more weight than preaching.
author: Chinese Proverb
Howard Arnold Walter

lines: Dare to be honest and fear no labor.
author: Robert Burns

lines: Action is character.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

lines: Hatred paralyzes life; love releases it. Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life; love illumines it.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: When two are of one mind, their strength can cut gold.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: To carry a grudge is like being stung to death by one bee.
author: William Walton

lines: What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: Aristotle

lines:
Have you had a kindness shown?

Pass it on;

'Twas not given for thee alone,

Pass it on;

Let it travel down the years,

Let it wipe another's tears,

'Til in Heaven the deed appears -

Pass it on.
author: Henry Burton

lines: It is an equal failing to trust everybody, and to trust nobody.
author: English Proverb

lines: Courtesy is the one coin you can never have too much of or be stingy with.
author: John Wanamaker

lines:
Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow.
Don't walk behind me, I may not lead.
Walk beside me and be my friend.
author: Albert Camus

lines: Many small people, in many small places, do many small things, that can alter the face of the world.
author: Anonymous

lines: One must always hope when one is desperate, and doubt when one hopes.
author: Gustave Flaubert

lines: Faith is taking the first step, even when you don't see the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Unity is power.
author: Arabic Proverb

lines: Greatness is not found in possessions, power, position, or prestige. It is discovered in goodness, humility, service, and character.
author: William Arthur Ward

lines: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
author: Eric Hoffer

lines: Change is the end result of all true learning. Change involves three things: First, a dissatisfaction with self - a felt void or need; second, a decision to change to fill the void or need; and third, a conscious dedication to the process of growth and change - the willful act of making the change, doing something.
author: Dr. Leo Buscaglia

lines: Most of us, swimming against the tides of trouble the world knows nothing about, need only a bit of praise or encouragement - and we will make the goal.
author: Jerome P. Fleishman

lines: Variety is the spice of life.
author: American Proverb

lines: You measure the size of the accomplishment by the obstacles you had to overcome to reach your goals!
author: Booker T. Washington

lines: The Pilgrims made seven times more graves than huts. No Americans have been more impoverished than these who, nevertheless, set aside a day of thanksgiving.
author: H. U. Westermayer

lines: I have a very strong feeling that the opposite of love is not hate - it's apathy.
author: Dr. Leo Buscaglia

lines: By the work one knows the workman.
author: Jean de La  Fontaine

lines: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: At twenty-five I should have worn a big red A on my chest; it would have stood for ambition, an ambition so brazen and burning that it would have reduced Hester Prynne's transgression to pale pink.
author: Anna Quindlen

lines: Any man's life will be filled with constant and unexpected encouragement if he makes up his mind to do his level best each day.
author: Booker T. Washington

lines: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

lines: If human beings are perceived as potentials rather than problems, as possessing strengths instead of weaknesses, as unlimited rather that dull and unresponsive, then they thrive and grow to their capabilities.
author: Barbara Bush

lines: Patience and time do more than strength or passion.
author: Jean de La  Fontaine

lines: Our children need our presence, not our presents.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: I read and walked for miles at night along the beach, writing bad blank verse and searching endlessly for someone wonderful who would step out of the darkness and change my life. It never crossed my mind that that person could be me.
author: Anna Quindlen

lines: I will permit no man to narrow and degrade my soul by making me hate him.
author: Booker T. Washington

lines: The deepest craving of human nature is the need to be appreciated.
author: William James

lines: Giving frees us from the familiar territory of our own needs by opening our mind to the unexplained worlds occupied by the needs of others.
author: Barbara Bush

lines: It is the small doubts of timid souls that accomplish their ruin. It is the narrow vision, the fear and trembling hesitation, that constitute defeat.
author: Alice Foote MacDougall

lines: Ideas are only lethal if you suppress and don't discuss them. Ignorance is not bliss, it's stupid. Banning books shows you don't trust your kids to think and you don't trust yourself to be able to talk to them.
author: Anna Quindlen

lines: God gave you a gift of 86,400 seconds today. Have you used one to say 'thank you?'
author: William Arthur Ward

lines: Forgiveness is man's deepest need and highest achievement.
author: Horace Bushnell

lines: Despising cowardice in others, I wished to prove myself no coward. Believing in the good, the gentle, the beautiful things of life, I addressed myself to the sweet duty of keeping these attributes for my children's sake and my own. And in striving to provide a living for them, I found a success beyond my wildest dreams.
author: Alice Foote MacDougall

lines: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Labor to keep alive in your breast that little spark of celestial fire called conscience.
author: George Washington

lines: Gratitude is the memory of the heart.
author: Jean-Baptiste  Massieu

lines: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.
author: Khalil Gibran

lines: The question Who am I? is not a philosophical football meant to be kicked around coffeehouses by pseudo-intellectuals. It's a real-life question. Nothing is more important and more relevant than to know who you are.
author: Chris Butler

lines: Much of the success of life depends upon keeping one's mind open to opportunity and seizing it when it comes.
author: Alice Foote MacDougall

lines: Our loyalties must transcend our race, our tribe, our class, and our nation; and this means we must develop a world perspective.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Those who can adapt to change are those who will continue to grow.
author: Justin Ramalho

lines: Not what we say about our blessings, but how we use them, is the true measure of our thanksgiving.
author: W. T.  Purkiser

lines: Optimism is the foundation of courage.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

lines: You can easily judge the character of others by how they treat those who can do nothing for them or to them.
author: Malcolm S. Forbes

lines: A blessed thing it is for any man or woman to have a friend, one human soul whom we can trust utterly, who knows the best and worst of us, and who loves us in spite of all our faults.
author: Charles Kingsley

lines: Achievement of your happiness is the only moral purpose of your life, and that happiness, not pain or mindless self-indulgence, is the proof of your moral integrity, since it is the proof and the result of your loyalty to the achievement of your values.
author: Ayn Rand

lines: Character is doing the right thing when nobody's looking. There are too many people who think that the only thing that's right is to get by, and the only thing that's wrong is to get caught.
author: J. C.  Watts

lines: Gratitude is happiness double by wonder.
author: G. K.  Chesterton

lines: I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
author: William Butler Yeats

lines: The very least you can do in your life is to figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

lines: The wise person understands that his own happiness must include the happiness of others.
author: Dennis Weaver

lines: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is a visible labor and there is an invisible labor.
author: Victor Hugo

lines: The longer I live, the more I am certain that the great difference between the great and the insignificant, is energy—invincible determination—a purpose once fixed, and then death or victory.
author: Sir Thomas Buxton

lines: I always prefer to believe the best of everybody-it saves so much trouble.
author: Rudyard Kipling

lines: From the smallest necessity to the highest religious abstraction, from the wheel to the skyscraper, everything we are and everything we have comes from one attribute of man — the function of his reasoning mind.
author: Ayn Rand

lines: The love of our neighbor in all its fullness simply means being able to say, What are you going through?
author: Simone Weil

lines: I don't wait for moods. You accomplish nothing if you do that. Your mind must know it has got to get down to work.
author: Pearl S.  Buck

lines: A man knows he has found his vocation when he stops thinking about how to live, and begins to live.
author: Thomas Merton

lines: With ordinary talents and extraordinary perseverance, all things are attainable.
author: Sir Thomas Buxton

lines: I will speak to a youth which can accomplish everything, precisely because it accepts no past, obeys no present, and fears no future.
author: Rudyard Kipling

lines: The purpose of morality is to teach you, not to suffer and die, but to enjoy yourself and live.
author: Ayn Rand

lines: If you can't excel with talent, triumph with effort.
author: Stephen G. Weinbaum

lines: Never work just for money or for power. They won't save your soul or help you sleep at night.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

lines: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.
author: Alexandre Dumas
Percy  Bysshe Shelley

lines: Great opportunities to help others seldom come, but small ones surround us every day.
author: Sally Koch

lines: In the name of the best within you, do not sacrifice this world to those who are its worst. In the name of the values that keep you alive, do not let your vision of man be distorted by the ugly, the cowardly, the mindless... Do not let your fire go out, spark by irreplaceable spark, in the hopeless swamps of the approximate, the not-quite, the not-yet, the not-at-all. Do not let the hero in your soul perish, in lonely frustration for the life you deserved, but have never been able to reach. Check your road and the nature of your battle. The world you desired can be won, it exists, it is real, it is possible, it's yours.
author: Ayn Rand

lines: Money matters, but less than we think and not in the way we think. Family is important. So are friends. Envy is toxic. So is excessive thinking. Beaches are optional. Trust is not. Neither is gratitude.
author: Eric Weiner

lines: Careers, like rockets, don't always take off on schedule. The key is to keep working the engines.
author: Gary Sinise

lines: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

lines: He is happy whose circumstances suit his temper; but he is more excellent who can suit his temper to any circumstances.
author: David Hume

lines: The moment of truth, the sudden emergence of a new insight, is an act of intuition. Such intuitions give the appearance of miraculous flushes, or short-circuits of reasoning. In fact they may be likened to an immersed chain, of which only the beginning and the end are visible above the surface of consciousness. The diver vanishes at one end of the chain and comes up at the other end, guided by invisible links.
author: Arthur Koestler

lines: When you have established that one alternative is good and the other is evil, there is no justification for the choice of a mixture. There is no justification ever for choosing any part of what you know to be evil.
author: Ayn Rand

lines: Our happiness is completely and utterly intertwined with other people: family, friends, neighbors and the woman who you hardly notice who cleans your office.
author: Eric Weiner

lines: Imagine what a harmonious world it could be if every single person, both young and old, shared a little of what he is good at doing.
author: Quincy Jones

lines: Integrity has no need of rules.
author: Albert Camus

lines: Some people think only intellect counts: knowing how to solve problems, knowing how to get by, knowing how to identify an advantage and seize it. But the functions of intellect are insufficient without courage, love, friendship, compassion and empathy.
author: Dean Koontz

lines: They had that special grace, that special spirit that says, Give me a challenge and I'll meet it with joy.
author: Ronald Reagan

lines: Long before I wrote stories, I listened for stories. Listening for them is something more acute than listening to them. I suppose it's an early form of participation in what goes on. Listening children know stories are there. When their elders sit and begin, children are just waiting and hoping for one to come out, like a mouse from its hole.
author: Eudora Welty

lines: An essential part of a happy, healthy life is being of service to others.
author: Susan Patton Thoele

lines: Be yourself. There is something that you can do better than any other. Listen to the inward voice and bravely obey that.
author: Unknown

lines: The brain may take advice, but not the heart, and love having no geography, knows no boundaries: weight and sink it deep, no matter, it will rise and find the surface.
author: Truman Capote

lines: To succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Michael Korda

lines: There is more learning in the question itself than the answer.
author: Andrew Weremy

lines: You will rise by lifting others.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

lines: The happiest people I have known have been those who gave themselves no concern about their own souls, but did their uttermost to mitigate the miseries of others.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

lines: In the end the aggressors always destroy themselves, making way for others who know how to cooperate and get along. Life is much less a competitive struggle for survival than a triumph of cooperation and creativity.
author: Fritjof Capra

lines: Honor isn't about making the right choices. It's about dealing with the consequences.
author: Midori Koto

lines: We are prone to judge success by the index of our salaries or the size of our automobiles, rather than by the quality of our service and relationship to humanity.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: Learn to get in touch with the silence within yourself, and know that everything in life has purpose. There are no mistakes, no coincidences. All events are blessings given to us to learn from.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

lines: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes; it takes more grit and gumption to forgive them for having witnessed your own.
author: Jessamyn West

lines: Hope is always available to us. When we feel defeated, we need only take a deep breath and say, "Yes," and hope will reappear.
author: Monroe Forester

lines: Snowflakes are one of nature's most fragile things, but just look at what they can do when they stick together.
author: Unknown

lines: Blessed is he who has found his work; let him ask no other blessedness.
author: Thomas Carlyle

lines: Old age is not a disease - it is strength and survivorship, triumph over all kinds of vicissitudes and disappointments, trials and illnesses.
author: Maggie Kuhn

lines: I think a hero is an ordinary individual who finds strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
author: Christopher Reeve

lines: If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. If you want happiness for a day, go fishing. If you want happiness for a year, inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime, help somebody.
author: Chinese Proverb

lines: Look for the good and praise it.
author: Unknown

lines: Permanence, perseverance and persistence in spite of all obstacles, discouragements, and impossibilities: It is this that in all things distinguishes the strong soul from the weak.
author: Thomas Carlyle

lines: Caring about others, running the risk of feeling, and leaving an impact on people, brings happiness.
author: Harold Kushner

lines: Maybe the Fountain of Youth isn't a fountain at all. Maybe it's a way of looking at things. A way of thinking.
author: Charles Whitley

lines: Believe, when you are most unhappy, that there is something for you to do in the world. So long as you can sweeten another's pain, life is not in vain.
author: Helen Keller

lines: I am happy for who I am, and what I have come to be. I look forward to whatever else that may come with positivity.
author: Cornelius Kilgore

lines: It is lack of love for ourselves that inhibits our compassion toward others. If we make friends with ourselves, then there is no obstacle to opening our hearts and minds to others.
author: Unknown

lines: A mystic bond of brotherhood makes all men one.
author: Thomas Carlyle

lines: It's the most breathtakingly ironic things about living: the fact that we are all...alone. Singular. And yet what we seek - what saves us - is our connection to others.
author: Wally Lamb

lines: We cannot really love anybody with whom we never laugh.
author: Agnes Repplier

lines: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

lines: Condemn none: if you can stretch out a helping hand, do so. If you cannot, fold your hands, bless your brothers, and let them go their own way.
author: Swami Vivekananda

lines: Don't be afraid to be amazing.
author: Andy Offutt Irwin

lines: Our grand duty is not to see what lies dimly in the distance, but to do what lies clearly at hand.
author: Thomas Carlyle

lines: Only connect.
author: E. M. Forster

lines: I do not at all understand the mystery of grace - only that it meets us where we are but does not leave us where it found us.
author: Anne Lamott

lines: Humor brings insight and tolerance. Irony brings a deeper and less friendly understanding.
author: Agnes Repplier

lines: I don't believe in aging. I believe in forever altering one's aspect to the sun. Hence my optimism.
author: Oscar Wilde

lines: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

lines: You can't stay in your corner of the forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
author: A. A. Milne

lines: You have it easily in your power to increase the sum total of this world's happiness now. How? By giving a few words of sincere appreciation to someone who is lonely or discouraged. Perhaps you will forget tomorrow the kind words you say today, but the recipient may cherish them over a lifetime.
author: Dale Carnegie

lines: One must be fond of people and trust them if one is not to make a mess of life.
author: E. M. Forster

lines: Promise yourself to be just as enthusiastic about the success of others as you are about your own.
author: Christian D. Larson

lines: Depend upon yourself. Make your judgement trustworthy by trusting it. You can develop good judgement as you do the muscles of your body - by judicious, daily exercise. To be known as a man of sound judgement will be much in your favor.
author: Grantland Rice

lines: Pleasure is Nature's test, her sign of approval. When man is happy, he is in harmony with himself and his environment.
author: Oscar Wilde

lines: Humility does not mean thinking less of yourself than of other people, nor does it mean having a low opinion of your own gifts. It means freedom from thinking about yourself at all.
author: William Temple

lines: Never talk defeat. Use words like hope, belief, faith, victory.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

lines: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
author: Dale Carnegie

lines: The fact is we can only love what we know personally. And we cannot know much. In public affairs, in the rebuilding of civilization, something less dramatic and emotional is needed, namely tolerance.
author: E. M. Forster

lines: The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination.
author: Thomas Tommy Lasorda

lines: They learn tolerance for others' faults through our tolerance of their own.
author: Cathy Ridner Tempelsman

lines: Ordinary riches can be stolen, real riches cannot. In your soul are infinitely precious things that cannot be taken from you.
author: Oscar Wilde

lines: It is well to remember that the entire population of the universe, with one trifling exception, is composed of others.
author: Andrew J. Holmes

lines: Love and respect are the most important aspects of parenting, and of all relationships.
author: Jodie  Foster

lines: The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.
author: D.H. Lawrence

lines: I beg you to have patience with everything unresolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves...Don't search for the answers, which could not be given to you now...the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

lines: What kills a skunk is the publicity it gives itself.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: Judge me not by physical size or appearance, but judge me by the size of my character.
author: Cornelius Kilgore

lines: Courage is only the accumulation of small steps.
author: George Konrad
