lines: An unshared life is not living. He who shares does not lessen, but greatens, his life.
author: Stephen S. Wise

lines:
How far that little candle throws his beams!
So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
author: William Shakespeare

lines: As the builders say, the larger stones do not lie well without the lesser.
author: Plato

lines: Devotion, when it does not lie under the check of reason, is apt to degenerate into enthusiasm.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: Obstacles cannot crush me. Every obstacle yields to stern resolve. He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

lines: I'll take fifty percent efficiency to get one hundred percent loyalty.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

lines: Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.
author: Jacques Maritain

lines: Compassion is the greatest form of love humans have to offer.
author: Rachel Joy Scott

lines: Excellence can be achieved if you . . . risk more than others think is safe, love more than others think is wise, dream more than others think is practical, and expect more than others think is possible.
author: Anonymous

lines: A mother is a person who seeing there are only four pieces of pie for five people, promptly announces she never did care for pie.
author: Tenneva Jordan

lines: It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are, the more gentle and quiet we become towards the defects of others.
author: Joseph Addison

lines:
I have been impressed with the urgency of doing.

Knowing is not enough; we must apply.

Being willing is not enough, we must do.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

lines: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracian

lines: The crest and crowning of all good, Life's final star, is Brotherhood.
author: Edwin Markham

lines: I will put honesty before the risk of humiliation.
author: Rachel Joy Scott

lines: He who forgives ends the quarrel.
author: Anonymous

lines: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others, cannot keep it from themselves.
author: James M. Barrie

lines: The great essentials for happiness in this life are something to do, something to love and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: To decide, to be at the level of choice, is to take responsibility for your life and to be in control of your life.
author: Abbie M. Dale

lines: Fame is a vapor, popularity an accident, riches take wings. Only one thing endures and that is character.
author: Horace Greeley

lines: Good timber does not grow with ease; the stronger the wind, the stronger the trees.
author: Willard Marriott

lines: Tomorrow is not a promise, but a chance.
author: Rachel Joy Scott

lines: Forgive many things in others; nothing in yourself.
author: Ausonuis

lines:
The soul, uneasy and confin'd from home,
 Rests and expatiates in a life to come.
author: Alexander Pope

lines: Dare to reach out your hand into the darkness, to pull another hand into the light.
author: Norman B. Rice

lines: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: Without a sense of caring, there can be no sense of community.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

lines: It is impossible to go through life without trust: that is to be imprisoned in the worst cell of all, oneself.
author: Graham Greene

lines: Morale is the state of mind. It is steadfastness and courage and hope. It is confidence and zeal and loyalty. It is élan, esprit de corps and determination.
author: George C. Marshall

lines: Trust and honesty is an investment you put in people.
author: Rachel Joy Scott

lines: Forgive, son; men are men; they needs must err.
author: Euripides

lines: Life is the soul's nursery.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

lines: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John R. Wooden

lines: Patience is a kind of love. A love that is its own explanation in bewildered circumstance. It is an old, old woman placing a wrinkled-parchment hand against the cheek of a reckless child. Because her heart is too wise to make room for reproach. Too full to find place for offense.
author: Pavithra  Mehta

lines: Our real blessings often appear to us in the shape of pains, losses and disappointments; but let us have patience and we soon shall see them in their proper figures.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: Never let your persistence and passion turn into stubbornness and ignorance.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

lines: Libraries are reservoirs of strength, grace and wit, reminders of order, calm and continuity, lakes of mental energy, neither warm nor cold, light nor dark. The pleasure they give is steady, unorgastic, reliable, deep and long-lasting.
author: Dr. Germaine Greer

lines: Let us not be content to wait and see what will happen, but give us the determination to make the right things happen.
author: Peter Marshall

lines: I admire those who trust and are trustworthy.
author: Rachel Joy Scott

lines: Friendship is love with understanding.
author: Proverb

lines: The soul was never put in the body to stand still.
author: John Webster

lines: There is a courage of happiness as well as a courage of sorrow.
author: Alfred Adler

lines: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

lines: You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

lines: What if you gave someone a gift, and they neglected to thank you for it - would you be likely to give them another? Life is the same way. In order to attract more of the blessings that life has to offer, you must truly appreciate what you already have.
author: Ralph Marston

lines: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

lines: Consult your friend on all things, especially on those which respect yourself. His counsel may then be useful where your own self-love might impair your judgment.
author: Seneca

lines: Give yourself the gift of time in coming to answers for your life…It takes time, and a lot of introspection and soul-searching, to get clear about what you really want to manifest in your life.
author: David Emerald

lines: Progress in every age results only from the fact that there are some men and women who refuse to believe that what they know to be right cannot be done.
author: Russell W. Davenport

lines: Let go of your attachment to being right, and suddenly your mind is more open. You're able to benefit from the unique viewpoints of others, without being crippled by your own judgment.
author: Ralph Marston

lines:
In thy face I see

The map of honor, truth, and loyalty.
author: William Shakespeare

lines: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
author: Confucius

lines: True achievement in any sphere of action depends upon real ability, and a strong, deep, whole-souled love.
author: David Emerald

lines: Love never reasons but profusely gives; gives, like a thoughtless prodigal, its all, and trembles lest it has done too little.
author: Hannah More

lines: It isn't the mountains ahead to climb that wear you out; it's the pebble in your shoe.
author: Muhammad Ali

lines: We need not think alike to love alike.
author: Francis  David

lines: Faith, a gift from God, is one of the most powerful forces governing our universe, just as the unseen power of gravity works to pull all things down, the unseen power of faith works to lifts all things up.
author: Gene Griffin

lines: You have many choices. You can choose forgiveness over revenge, joy over despair. You can choose action over apathy.
author: Stephanie Marston

lines: Virtue is bold, and goodness never fearful.
author: William Shakespeare

lines: A friend is someone who reached for your hand and touched your heart.
author: Unknown

lines: A smile is a light in the window of the soul indicating that the heart is at home.
author: Christian D. Larson

lines: Hope is not pretending that troubles don't exist. It is the hope that they won't last forever. That hurts will be healed and difficulties overcome. That we will be led out of the darkness and into the sunshine.
author: Anonymous

lines: To all those who walk the path of human cooperation war must appear loathsome and inhuman.
author: Alfred Adler

lines: Any necessary work that pays an honest wage carries its own honor and dignity.
author: W. Kelly Griffith

lines: The most fortunate are those who have a wonderful capacity to appreciate again and again, freshly and naively, the basic goods of life, with awe, pleasure, wonder, and even ecstasy.
author: Abraham Maslow

lines: Alack, when once our grace we have forgot, Nothing goes right; we would, and we would not.
author: William Shakespeare

lines: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
author: Aesop

lines: Hard work and togetherness. They go hand in hand. You need the hard work because it's such a tough atmosphere... to win week in and week out. You need togetherness because you don't always win, and you gotta hang though together.
author: Tony Dungy
